Sector: Software Servicios y tecnologías de la información Internet
Descripción:
Description

We are looking for a Data Scientist to help Amazon Search NLP to build an Search evaluation data set. It is a short (5-month) full-time job starting ASAP. We are looking for an individual interested in search and search relevance (quality), with the patience to analyze hundreds of queries and search results, and with the ingenuity to propose new leads. The work is likely to lead to a publication and the creation of a public dataset, which could be well cited. Basic coding and data manipulation skills are required, as well as some experience analyzing data qualitatively and English writing skills. Background in IR theory or ML is not necessary.

A Typical Day May Consist Of
Manually Evaluate queries and query search results, annotating them with information about query types, relevance, issues, etc.
Write simple Python notebook code to sample data, to compute evaluation metrics, etc.
Write documentation describing the datasets and their statistics.
Design new experiments, query types, and mechanisms for sampling and evaluating.
The Search NLP team is responsible for developing and deploying state of the art machine learning and NLP models to extract semantic information from product search queries, item descriptions, reviews, and many other sources of information created by millions of Amazon customers each day. You will be working alongside world-class scientists and engineers to build next generation search systems.

Amazon Science (www.amazon.science) gives you insight into the company’s approach to customer-obsessed scientific innovation. Amazon fundamentally believes that scientific innovation is essential to being the most customer-centric company in the world. It’s the company’s ability to have an impact at scale that allows us to attract some of the brightest minds in artificial intelligence and related fields. Our scientists continue to publish, teach, and engage with the academic community, in addition to utilizing our working backwards method to enrich the way we live and work.


Basic Qualifications
M.S. in Computer Science, Data Science, Machine Learning, Operational Research, Statistics or a related quantitative field
1+ years of hands-on experience in data analysis for large scale applications
1+ years hands-on experience in Python, Perl, Scala, Java, C#, C++ or other similar languages
Experience in designing experiments and statistical analysis of results.
Superior verbal and written communication and presentation skills.
Ability to convey mathematical results to non-science stakeholders. Strength in clarifying and formalizing complex problems.
Preferred Qualifications
Ph.D. (or enroled in PhD program) in Search, Natural Language Processing, Machine Learning, or a related quantitative field.
1+ years of practical industry experience in Search, Data Analysis, or Information Retrieval.
Technical fluency; comfort understanding and discussing architectural concepts and algorithms,
A passion for innovation
Excellent critical thinking skills, combined with the ability to present your beliefs clearly and compellingly in both verbal and written form.

Sector: Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
The purpose of Zurich is...

What are we looking for?

You will join the Data & Analytics team, consisting of data scientists who are passionate about building cutting edge solutions to solve real-world business challenges.

Leverage data to develop innovative models using latest machine learning & advanced analytics techniques.
Ensure data quality through data cleaning.
Manipulate high-volume, high-dimensionality data to highlight patterns, relationships, anomalies and trends.
Work with business stakeholders to understand the business needs, develop and defend actionable solutions to business challenges.
Communicate results and solutions to diverse audience across the organization, within the Spanish Business Unit and at Global level.
Contribute to one or more of the following areas: forecasting, A/B testing, customer analytics (churn prediction, cross sell), personalization & recommender design, fraud detection, graph analytics, text analytics, image recognition.

What do we need?

At least 2 years relevant data-intensive project/ industry experience as a data scientist.
Experience in designing, developing and deploying analytical solutions; experience in deploying analytical solutions in Cloud (AWS) would be considered a plus.
Detailed knowledge of statistical and predictive modelling concepts and disciplines.
Academic experience, preferably at Master level, in one or more of the following areas: Mathematics, Statistics, Physics, Computer Science, Econometrics, Finance, or other data/math intensive field.
Proven track record of programming in Python.
Knowledge of ML libraries: sklearn, pandas, pyspark, nltk, different OCRs, web APIs, MLOps practices is considered a plus.
Fluent Spanish and English are fundamental pre-requisites and international experience is considered a plus.
Highly collaborative working style.
Strong drive for excellence.
Proactive.
Good communication skills. Ability to exchange ideas and convey complex information clearly and concisely.

For being from zurich

At Zurich we want to take care of you and these are some of your benefits:

Flexible compensation.
Restaurant card.
Home office voucher.
Flexwork: 20 hours a week to work where and when you want.
Pension plan - Life insurance.
Bank and insurance offer.
Discount in gyms.
Zurich Wellness, sports activities.
Zurich Sports Club, free registration for marathons and popular races.
Free English classes.

About Us

Our nearly 55,000 employees in more than 215 countries and territories are the foundation of our success. They are the ones who enable companies and communities to confront a world of risk with confidence. Imagine if you could help people do this all over the world. You would give them confidence and peace of mind by protecting what they love the most. It is a great challenge, but you will have the support of a great international team that is ready to help you so that you can reach your full potential and thus fulfill our promises. We have already started and we are changing the way of making insurance. For this we need talented people, the desire to learn and passion! Will you join us?

"Zurich, 14 consecutive years as Top Employer"

Zurich Insurance has and applies an equal employment opportunity policy. Our goal is to attract and retain the best professionals without discriminating on disability, race, nationality, religion, gender, sexual orientation or age.

Data Engineer

- Experiencia en la creación de modelos de datos, integrando y gestionando conjuntos de datos de diferentes fuentes.
- Habilidades interpersonales: Ser capaz de entender y comunicar efectivamente y conseguir consenso de todas partes implicadas para adoptar soluciones eficaces y duraderas.

Descripción:
Anunciado por
Julia Abad Castelló
Talent Acquisition Specialist en WIRIS
Enviar mensaje InMail
We are WIRIS, a software development company founded 20 years ago and headquartered in Barcelona with offices in the USA, Long Beach (California) since we acquired Design Science company in 2017. We are currently more than 60 people doing what we like, with deep knowledge in advanced technology and science.

Over the past few years, we’ve been named as “The Makers of MathType”, revolutionizing the educational field with innovative methods. In spite of the recent global pandemic, we’re continuously growing and keep developing new products and continually improving our value proposition for a global audience.
 Our Business Intelligence team is growing and we are looking for a Data Engineer to be responsible for expanding our data pipelines, as well as optimizing data flow and collection for cross functional teams. The right candidate will be a person who’s able to understand the business, and is able to provide solutions.
 Key Responsibilities
Collect, process, and clean data from different sources to be stored in our data lake
Design, implement and maintain scalable ETL data pipelines using cloud technologies that produce reliable insights
Design and develop visualizations and dashboards to support business analysis 
Work with stakeholders to assist with data-related problems and support their data / information needs.
Caring about documentation and quality both in process and implementation
Be an active member of the team, acting as a mentor to other teammates

Job Requirements
B.S / Msc in Computer Science or related fields
1-3 years of experience as a data engineer or a similar role
Fluent English and Spanish 
Good understanding of software development and agile methodologies
Strong knowledge of SQL and coding skills in object oriented programming (Python)
Strong knowledge of Python Data Science Stack (namely NumPy, SciPy, Pandas, Jupyter, etc)
Experience with serverless (Lambda, Glue) technologies (AWS solutions in particular)
Experience of Git, GitHub actions (or other CI/CD solutions) and Docker 
Experience working with modern BI tools (like Quicksight and Tableau)
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills
Good written and verbal communication skills

We offer:
Full time permanent position
Competitive salary + optional flex salary plan
Flexible working hours
Private health insurance 
Financial aid for work-related training or courses
In-house English lessons to improve your knowledge
Great work environment in Barcelona city center
All the coffee you can drink, fresh fruit and yoghurt

Sector: Venta al por menor
Funciones laborales: Análisis Negocios Tecnología de la información
Descripción:
Buscamos un/a Data Scientist para que se incorpore a nuestro equipo de Insights. Formarás parte del equipo de Data que configura la estrategia, la arquitectura y la infraestructura de datos de Mango.
 ¿CÓMO ES NUESTRO EQUIPO?
 En Mango inspiramos y unimos mediante nuestra pasión por el estilo y la cultura. Estamos en 118 países y nuestra presencia online se extiende a más de 80 países. Nuestro equipo está formado por personas de 112 nacionalidades y en un 80% por mujeres.
 Somos un equipo muy dinámico, motivado por las nuevas tecnologías, con pasión por lo que hacemos y abiertos a afrontar grandes retos que nos permitan seguir creciendo y aportando valor a través de los datos.
 ¿QUÉ HACE UN/A INSIGHTS DATA SCIENTIST EN MANGO?
 Tu objetivo será utilizar análisis avanzados para dar forma a la estrategia de negocio de Mango con un rol de consultoría interna.
 En tu día a día…
 Usarás técnicas de análisis avanzadas para resolver preguntas desafiantes de negocio que influyen directamente o dicta nuestra estrategia.
Trabajarás con grandes volúmenes de datos no estructurados, como Clickstream de nuestros canales digitales y señales RFID de nuestras tiendas.
Usarás algoritmos matemáticos: modelos geográficos (huff gravity, distance decay…), modelos de segmentación (clustering…) o modelos de predicción (random forest…)
Dibujarás, estructurarás y comunicarás a los diferentes stackeholders insights y recomendaciones de negocio basadas en el análisis de los datos.
Interactuarás con los diferentes stackeholder claves de toda la empresa en Online, Cliente, Producto, Retail y Supply Chain.
  ¿QUÉ ESPERAMOS DE TI?
 Que tengas un grado en ingeniería, matemáticas, estadística o económicas.
Que aportes experiencia en el desarrollo de modelos matemáticos avanzados y en el manejo de grandes volúmenes de datos no estructurados.
Que aportes experiencia desarrollando en Python y/o R y SQL.
Que tengas capacidad para extraer insights de negocio a partir de los datos y crear presentaciones efectivas para comunicarlos.
Que tengas fuertes habilidades interpersonales para mantener conversaciones sobre negocio.
Que tengas pasión por los datos y habilidades de liderazgo empresarial, como la estructuración de problemas, buena comunicación para la realización de presentaciones.
Muy valorable tener experiencia en una consultoría estratégica o en empresa final de primer nivel.
  ¿QUÉ NOS HACE ESPECIALES? 
Incorporación inmediata con contrato indefinido
Horario flexible y jornada intensiva los viernes. 50% homeworking.
Formarás parte de una empresa líder en el sector de la moda, dinámica y en plena innovación.
Trabajarás con un gran equipo que va en la misma dirección para conseguir los mejores resultados.
Ambiente de trabajo cercano, inspirador y ambicioso.
25% de descuento en todas nuestras líneas (Woman, Man, Kids, Violeta y Accesorios)
Market de muestrario para renovar tu armario dos veces al año
Transporte gratuito de empresa desde Barcelona y el Vallés.
Formación en idiomas, mindfulness y programas de desarrollo personal, entre otros.
Beneficios sociales y descuentos.
Mango Talks mensuales sobre transformación digital, moda y la actividad de nuestros equipos.
Oportunidades constantes de desarrollo con retos muy variados que generan aprendizaje en el puesto de trabajo.

Descripción:
Mission
As a Junior Data Analyst you will support and empower Yego´s departments with key data that will allow them to make strategic decisions and improve business performance.
Reporting to the Data Scientist Lead, this role is embedded in the day-to-day business performance and holds the reporting responsibilities for Yego.
The Junior Data Analyst will be a key partner for Operations and Marketing departments providing and analyzing performance trends, user acquisition, and retention rates, rides forecast, operations performance, etc.

Responsibilities
Business KPIs reporting
Product Analytics, tracking and reporting on the product features and improvements
Maintaining and improving the reporting and visualization outcomes
Identify, analyze and interpret trends and anomalies in the data for different departments, communicate findings
Provide insight, guidance, and recommendations to Operations and Marketing by interpreting and analyzing the business data
Discovering and exploring datasets and proposing new tracking to improve data sources and decisions
Forecasting and setting targets at department/function level to reach objectives as well as working with the teams to see business cases for uplifts in the KPIs results

Requirements

BS degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Physics, Business Administration or related fields.
1-2 years of experience in relevant roles
Knowledge of statistical methods and data analysis techniques for both quantitative and qualitative data analysis
Possess advanced computer skills knowledge, experience working with different databases and data warehousing understanding
Strong knowledge of and experience with SQL (MySQL or Postgresql), and understanding of ETL programming (Python)
Expertise in statistical analysis and experience using tools to report and visualize (Tableau, R, Python, Cluvio, and others)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to collect, organize, analyze and disseminate significant amounts of information with attention to detail and accuracy
Good communication and presentation skills as well as utilize data obtained and analysis performed to guide the business performance

Perks
Participating in changing mobility for good into a cool, hassle-free, and environmentally-friendly experience with passionate people to work on the same goal.
Private Health Insurance.
Gym membership discounts.
Unlimited use of Yego vehicles.
Flexible working hours and remote working conditions.

Experiencia

Responder a los retos de Negocio extrayendo conocimiento a partir de los datos desarrollando modelos de Inteligencia Artificial/ Machine Learning. Investigar de manera proactiva nuevas técnicas de trabajo con los datos buscando facilitadores para futuros Casos de Uso.
 Responsabilidades
Análisis de las necesidades de Áreas de Negocio.
Diseño de la solución, colaborando con arquitectos de los datos.
Trabajo con múltiples conjuntos de datos de diferentes tipos/formatos, incluyendo el procesamiento y depuración necesario para desarrollar estudios estadísticos y algoritmos.
Programación de las funciones/algoritmos para ser aplicados sobre conjuntos de datos.
Identificación qué algoritmos/técnicas estadísticas deben aplicarse de cara a resolver retos específicos de negocio.
Desarrollo de los modelos de ML.
Creación de los mecanismos de monitorización de modelos.
Capacidad para transmitir a negocio en lenguaje sencillo el trabajo realizado y conseguir despertar su interés por los proyectos de Data Science.
Investigación e implementación de las mejores prácticas en el análisis de datos, Machine Learning y Artificial Intelligence.

Perfil
Requisitos:
Formación académica: matemáticas aplicadas, estadística, informática
Master/especialización en Big Data o Data Science
Imprescindible experiencia de más de 4 años en puesto de Data Science
Capacidad para trabajar de forma autónoma, resolviendo problemas en entornos de alta incertidumbre, tener iniciativa y capacidad de innovación
Actitud curiosa y reflexiva para tratar de responder a preguntas de negocio en un entorno muy cambiante

 Conocimientos:

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
At TomTom…You’ll move the world forward. Every day, we create the most innovative mapping and location technologies to shape tomorrow’s mobility for the better.

We are proud to be one team of more than 5,000 unique, curious, passionate problem-solvers spread across the world. We bring out the best in each other. And together, we help the automotive industry, businesses, developers, drivers, citizens and cities move towards a safe, autonomous world that is free of congestion and emissions.

What You’ll Do
Collecting large amounts of unruly (spatial) data and transforming it into a more usable format.
Solve business-related problems using data-driven techniques
Working with a variety of programming languages, including SAS, R and Python
Staying on top of analytical techniques such as machine learning, deep learning and text analytics.
Identify patterns in data, as well as spotting trends that can help improving the business’s bottom line
Communicating and collaborating with both Software Engineering and with the Maps Operations Team globally
Share and present your data analysis insights to key decision maker to enable them to achieve company strategy
What you’ll need:
University Degree in computer science, Mathematics, Statistic or similar.
3+ year experience as Data Scientist
Familiar with Microsoft cloud computing: Azure & Databricks
Programming experience with Python, R and SQL
Experience in creating statistical models
Big Data analysis expertise
Experience creating Mathematical models, algorithms, prediction models using Machine Learning.
Great experience with data visualization (storytelling) (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)
Fluent English
Nice to have:
Experience with Scala & PySparks
Previous Experience with Spatial Data
Meet your teamWe’re Maps, a product unit within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is comprised of over 2,000 people in 40 countries – all driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for the hundreds of millions of people using TomTom maps around the world. Joining our team, you’ll help continuously innovate our map-making processes, create a real-time closed loop between detected changes in the real world and the users’ map, and build maps that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

Achieve more We are self-starters who play well with others. Every day, we solve new problems with creativity, meet new people and learn rapidly at our offices around the world. We will invest in your growth and are committed to supporting you. In everything we do, we’re guided by six values: We care, putting our heart into what we do; we build trust (you can count on us); we create – driven to make a difference; we are confident, but don’t boast; we keep it simple, since life is complex enough; and we have fun because life’s too short to be boring.

After you applyOur recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout the process, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews through your onboarding.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employerWe celebrate diversity, thrive on each other’s differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment at our offices around the world. Naturally, we do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, national origin, genetics, or age.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Servicios financieros Banca
Descripción:
JOB

Koalaboox is a fast growing FinTech developing over Europe with > 40 employees. Since 2012, we offer a SaaS platform allowing small business owners to manage their business while providing a seamless financing solution.
 With > 400 Mio € financing volume / year, Koalaboox invoice financing solution is one of the most efficient worldwide. All credit decisions are instant and automated.
 Koalaboox is recruiting a junior data scientist to integrate its credit risk & modelling team. Reporting to the head of credit risk you will be tasked with analytical problems to explore and solve, related with the business and operations at Koalaboox. In addition, you will have the opportunity to be directly involved in model development and model monitoring using on our machine learning framework. 

YOUR RESPONSIBILITIES

 Understand the business and identify points of interest to study and explore analytically using the analytical tool in place. 
Participate on ETL/data structures’ development to support analytical studies and model development. 
Master the machine learning platform in place to ensure model’s performance follow-up. 
Identify new statistical or analytical methods and keep in touch with news from the scientific community. 

 YOUR PROFILE
 Background in applied mathematics, statistics, physics, computer science or similar. 
Experience in predictive model’s development and analytical studies. 
Experience in SAS will be preferable (Python experience will also be considered a plus). 
Autonomous and proficient, being rigorous in the work delivered. 
Fluent in english (french will be a plus). 

 OUR OFFER
 Integration in a smart company with great environment, strongly oriented for fintech and innovative products. 
To be directly involved in a machine learning end-to-end process allowing to gain full experience on the subject. 
Participate in internal projects and developments having direct influence on Koalaboox’s business and result. 
Attractive salary according with experience.

Programming experience with Python, R and SQL
Experience in creating statistical models
Big Data analysis expertise
Experience creating Mathematical models, algorithms, prediction models using Machine Learning.
Great experience with data visualization (storytelling) (e.g. Tableau, PowerBI)
Fluent English

Nice to have
Experience with Scala & PySparks
Previous Experience with Spatial Data

Meet your team
We’re Maps, a product unit within TomTom’s Location Technology Products technical unit. Our team is comprised of over 2,000 people in 40 countries – all driven to deliver the most up-to-date, accurate and detailed maps for the hundreds of millions of people using TomTom maps around the world. Joining our team, you’ll help continuously innovate our map-making processes, create a real-time closed loop between detected changes in the real world and the users’ map, and build maps that will enable the future of autonomous driving.

Achieve more
We are self-starters who play well with others. Every day, we solve new problems with creativity, meet new people and learn rapidly at our offices around the world. We will invest in your growth and are committed to supporting you. In everything we do, we’re guided by six values We care, putting our heart into what we do; we build trust (you can count on us); we create – driven to make a difference; we are confident, but don’t boast; we keep it simple, since life is complex enough; and we have fun because life’s too short to be boring.

After you apply
Our recruitment team will work hard to give you a meaningful experience throughout the process, no matter the outcome. Your application will be screened closely and you can rest assured that all follow-up actions will be thorough, from assessments and interviews through your onboarding.

TomTom is an equal opportunity employer
We celebrate diversity, thrive on each other’s differences and are committed to creating an inclusive environment at our offices around the world. Naturally, we do not discriminate against any employee or job applicant because of race, religion, color, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity or expression, marital status, disability, national origin, genetics, or age.

Descripción:
About Accenture

Accenture is a leading global professional services company, providing a broad range of services at scale in strategy and consulting, interactive, technology and operations, with digital capabilities across all off these services.

We combine unmatched experience and specialized capabilities across more than 40 industries – powered by the world’s largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers.

With 513,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries, Accenture brings continuous innovation to help clients improve their performance and create lasting value across their enterprises.

Working closely with clients our Strategy & Consulting professionals help transform the world’s leading organizations, working across the C-suite to capitalize on disruption, enable competitiveness, and drive growth and profitability via continuous innovation.

About Supply Chain And Operations Applied Intelligence

Part of Accenture Strategy and Consulting, we help our clients grow their business in entirely new ways. Artificial Intelligence and Analytics enable our clients to achieve high performance through insights from data - insights that inform better decisions and strengthen customer relationships.

The Barcelona Innovation Center has been at the forefront in helping clients from around the globe and across industries under the umbrella of intelligent operations for the last 15 years. We develop cutting-edge assets and solutions to reduce costs and improve supply chain processes, such as optimization of stock levels, demand planning and forecasting, automated warranty solutions, and predictive asset maintenance.

Our team is composed of over 90 data scientists and Data Engineers with specialized background in Supply Chain & Operations, 20% of which are PhD’s in the areas of Mathematics, Computer Science, Physics or Statistics. All that knowledge, combined with Accenture’s business experience, fosters an environment that allows us to quickly react to changing business conditions and provide tailored solution for our client’s needs.

Data Engineer role

Introduction

You will have the opportunity of being part of the Data Analyst group, working for our top clients in the evolution of their core systems and the implementation of new digital architectures. As part of the group, you will be trained on new Data architecture, and you can take part of certification processes for those technologies.

Your role

To grow up your skills working on challenging and innovative solutions

Working in new technologies with demanding clients and growing your expertise
Working in highly skilled teams advising and supporting our clients through the data and technology revolution

Working in partnership with global clients and large public/private sector organizations

Work with client teams to design and implement modern, scalable data solutions using a range of new and emerging technologies.

A drive to keep up with new and/or up and coming data technologies, especially open-source frameworks

Key Responsibilities

Design and implement the data architecture for our clients based on new data technologies.

Design the integration with legacy data sources.

Define the standards and best practices to develop applications using new architectures.

Using good communication skills to understand and deliver client requirements.

Bring your experience and ideas to innovative engineering, design and strategy.

Contribute to our internal networks and special interest groups.

Recommend ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality

Collaborate with data architects, modelers and IT team members on project goals

Build high-performance algorithms, prototypes, and proof of concepts

Skills You Will Need

Programming in tools like R, PYTHON, C++, JavaScript, C#, Java, PHP.

SQL-based technologies, e.g. PostgreSQL and MySQL

NoSQL technologies, e.g. Cassandra, MongoDB

Other database tools, e.g. SCADA

Knowledge in Bid Data Frameworks, e.g. Hadoop (Especially HBase, Spark, MapReduce, Hive, HDFS

Knowledge of the ELK stack (exposure preferred)

Unix and Unix-like systems

Knowledge of cloud-based solutions, e.g. AWS, Azure, Google Cloud

Data modeling tools, e.g. ERWin, Enterprise Architect, and Visio

Knowledge in Data Base tools like Redshift (AWD), Casandra DB, Mongo DB, SQL Database, Hadoop, SCADA.

Data Ingestion/transformation tools like Alteryx, Talend, SQL, J2EE, Big Query

Análisis, diseño y desarrollo de soluciones de ciencia de datos en operadores de Tráfico y Transporte de pasajeros, con orígenes de datos muy masivos.
Integración con otros sistemas como, Sistemas de ayuda a la explotación (SAE), Sistemas de Conteo de personas, Matriz O/D.

Participar en las tareas de estimación, evaluación y diseño de soluciones técnicas.

SOBRE INETUM, POSITIVE DIGITAL FLOW

Inetum es una compañía de servicios ágil que proporciona servicios y soluciones digitales y un grupo global que ayuda a compañías e instituciones a aprovechar al máximo el flow digital.

En un contexto de continuo movimiento, en el que las necesidades y los usos se reinventan constantemente, el grupo Inetum se compromete con todos esos actores a innovar, seguir adaptándose y mantenerse a la vanguardia.

Con su perfil multi-experto, Inetum ofrece a sus clientes una combinación única de proximidad, organización sectorial y soluciones de calidad industrial. Presente en más de 26 países, el Grupo tiene cerca de 27.000 empleados y en 2019 generó unos ingresos de 2.300 millones de euros (pro forma).

Senior Data Scientist

Responsabilidades clave: Sus responsabilidades incluyen, pero no se limitan a:

Ser el responsable del ciclo de vida completo, desde la conceptualización hasta la obtención de requisitos, el diseño, la implementación y el despliegue de las soluciones de data science.
Trabajar e interactuar activamente con el equipo de trabajo, así como con los externos para comprender las preguntas comerciales y traducirlas en guías e instrucciones técnicas.
Experiencia tanto en la preparación y el procesamiento de datos, como la evaluación de la calidad de los datos, la creación de nuevas variables, la selección de variables, etc.
Capacidad para crear modelos predictivos avanzados utilizando conceptos como Series Temporales, Modelos predictivos y de clasificación incluyendo Técnicas de Regresión y Redes Neuronales Artificiales.
Habilidad para construir y ajustar algoritmos que escalan desde la etapa de prueba de concepto a pequeña escala hasta sistemas de producción completos.
Evaluar nuevos desarrollos tecnológicos y requisitos comerciales en evolución, y hacer recomendaciones para mejorar los niveles de servicio y la eficiencia.
Asegurar que los proyectos que utilizan consultores externos sobre la ciencia de datos o proveedores de arquitecturas cloud se manejen bien mediante un compromiso continuo
Fuertes habilidades interpersonales y de comunicación, y capacidad para comunicar contenido analítico y técnico con claridad tanto a expertos como a no expertos.
Dominio del inglés (hablado y escrito)

Requerimientos mínimos

Licenciada en Matemáticas, Estadística, Informática, Física o en un campo cuantitativo
Más de 2 años de experiencia de posgrado en un entorno de análisis y datos multidisciplinarios o en investigación; experiencia en modelado predictivo y análisis de grandes datos
Experiencia en herramientas estadísticas / analíticas como Python o R y tecnologías de big data para aprendizaje automático
Experiencia en entornos cloud para proyectos de datos
Un historial de innovación a través del aprendizaje automático, bases de datos y algoritmos estadísticos y sus aplicaciones. Experiencia práctica en minería de datos, sus conceptos, técnicas e implementación.
Automotivado con un alto grado de propiedad y responsabilidad por los resultados
Capacidad demostrada para influir y establecer relaciones con personas en todos los niveles y organizaciones, interna y externamente, en múltiples geografías.

Paquetes de data science como sikit-learn, keras y similares.

Sector: Consultoría de estrategia y operaciones
Descripción:
Así Somos

The Cocktail es una consultora digital cuya misión es orquestar y acelerar el crecimiento de nuestros clientes. Lo conseguimos porque hay una cosa que sabemos hacer muy bien: movilizar organizaciones para impulsar la relación entre las marcas y clientes mediante el diseño de productos y servicios, los datos y la tecnología digital. Entendemos lo que nuestros clientes necesitan y construimos capacidades a ritmo de mercado y a una velocidad de vértigo.
Nuestro entorno de trabajo se caracteriza por el crecimiento profesional exponencial, y la participación en proyectos con impacto real en grandes clientes. El ecosistema de especialistas es amplio y diverso (estrategia, diseño, tecnología, data, investigación…) y la interacción entre los equipos es nuestro día a día.
Formar parte de The Cocktail implica rodearse de personas referentes e inspiradoras de quien aprender, y que te ayudarán a crecer frente a los retos que te encontrarás. Trabajamos bajo la máxima de que es mejor pedir perdón que permiso y en un entorno en el que se aprende del error. Por eso, esperamos de quienes forman la compañía que aporten una visión disruptiva y challenger, sean inconformistas buscando la excelencia y se apropien de los desafíos..
Si quieres moverte en un equipo retador, empujar proyectos innovadores y en definitiva, hacer que las cosas pasen, The Cocktail es para ti.

Éste es el reto

Buscamos una persona enfocada a consultoría en el campo de Data Science, con ganas de incorporarse al equipo de Data Science & Engineering & Visualization, capaz de liderar soluciones que den respuesta a los problemas de negocio de grandes empresas. Que pueda también llevar las soluciones implementadas a entornos de producción y demostrar su impacto con un business case.
Nuestro equipo de de Data Science & Engineering & Visualization se encarga de entender las necesidades de nuestros clientes, pertenecientes a todo tipo de sectores (Banca, Real Estate, Retail, etc..) y ofrecerles la mejor solución basada en la ciencia e ingeniería de datos. Para ello, el departamento cuenta con especialistas en ambos campos.
Trabajamos en entorno cloud (GCP, AWS, Azure) y usamos las herramientas adecuadas para cada problema en concreto.


¿Qué esperamos?

+3 años de experiencia traduciendo necesidades de negocio a modelos analíticos, así como la interpretación de los resultados de un modelo analítico en términos de negocio.
Experiencia profesional con modelos matemáticos avanzados basados en técnicas de machine learning y/o inteligencia artificial, especialmente en modelos predictivos de clasificación y clusterización.
Conocimientos de bases de datos relacionales y fuentes no relacionales/NoSQL.
Tener conocimientos de programación y bibliotecas de tratamiento de datos y machine learning. Manejo avanzado de Python
Conocer la metodología MLOps y en general la metodología DevOps
Nivel de inglés alto
Tener sentido del humor y ganas de pasarlo bien con nosotros.

Además, nos encantaría que:

Estés acostumbrado a trabajar con algunos de los siguientes paradigmas: series temporales, procesamiento de lenguaje natural, análisis geo-espacial, reconocimiento de imágenes, etc.
Tengas conocimientos sobre técnicas de optimización numérica: gradient descent, quasi-Newton, computación evolutiva, programación lineal, etc.
Hayas trabajado con soluciones cloud (Google Cloud Platform, Amazon Web Services, Microsoft Azure), y la realización de prototipos/productos web en frameworks ágiles.
Estar familiarizado con entornos Big Data.
Poseas conocimientos en herramientas de visualización: Tableau, Power BI, Qlik Sense, Shiny, Spotfire, etc.
No seas alérgico a los perros (tenemos a Maggie en la oficina).

La experiencia en The Cocktail:
Modelo de trabajo basado en la autorresponsabilidad y la autogestión con horario flexible y teletrabajo (de verdad). 
Formación pensada para tu desarrollo profesional e individual. 
Acceso a una red de gimnasios por un precio especial.
27 merecidos días de vacaciones al año y, por si no son suficientes, puedes disfrutar de hasta 5 días más de extra time. 
Seguro médico privado con cobertura completa.
Posibilidad de retribución flexible (tarjeta restaurante, tarjeta transporte o cheque guardería).
Un equipo de trabajo a tu medida para que uses el sistema operativo que más te guste.
No tenemos dress code. Ven como quieras a trabajar. 
Nuestras oficinas están ubicadas en el centro de la ciudad, tanto en Madrid como en Oviedo.
Ser parte de una compañía con alma: no solo por ser dog friendly (tenemos a Maggie en la oficina) si no porque además, estamos concienciados con la maternidad (tenemos una sala de lactancia y programas para mamás y papás), el bienestar (con mindfulness diarios), la sostenibilidad (iniciativas zero waste), la igualdad de género y diversidad (acciones en la semana del orgullo LGTBI+, donaciones...).

En The Cocktail pretendemos ser un referente en talento y calidad humana, y sólo lo conseguiremos siendo una compañía abierta y diversa, por eso tenemos un Código de Conducta que refleja nuestras expectativas de las personas que participan en la empresa. Ofrecemos un entorno acogedor para todas las personas, independientemente de su identidad o expresión de género, orientación sexual, capacidad, origen, religión, estatus socioeconómico…

Próximos pasos:

Si has llegado hasta aquí es porque hemos conseguido llamar tu atención ;)

Apúntate a la oferta y el equipo de People echará un vistazo a tu CV. Si coincide con lo que buscamos, recibirás una llamada para conocernos mejor, que podamos contarte más sobre The Cocktail y el sobre el rol.

Nuestros procesos de selección suelen tener alrededor de dos o tres entrevistas, y es posible que en algún momento queramos verte en acción y te propongamos un reto técnico. Al final del proceso charlaremos acerca de las condiciones salariales del puesto, una vez te conozcamos bien y sepamos cuánto puedes aportar.

Si necesitas un tip para el proceso: simplemente queremos que seas tú.

Si te apasiona investigar,analizar e innovar! Esta es la oportunidad que estabas buscando. 

¿Qué harás en nuestro equipo?

Tu misión será liderar y desarrollar proyectos de innovación que nos permitan estar a la vanguardia en la aplicación de nuevas soluciones basadas en datos. Y además...

Colaborarás de manera transversal con el resto de la organización proponiendo soluciones innovadoras basadas en datos. 
Desarrollar procesos de extracción y transformación de información.
Desarrollarás visualizaciones de datos que permitan transmitir los resultados a la organización.
Analizarás tendencias de mercado e identificarás nuevas tecnologías que nos permitan desarrollar propuestas  innovadoras. 
Desarrollarás de manera autónoma, pruebas de concepto que permitan evaluar las distintas propuestas de valor.
Identificarás nuevas fuentes de información internas y externas que puedan enriquecer el conocimiento de nuestros clientes.
Investigarás y diseñarás nuevas soluciones y áreas de aplicación relacionadas con datos y analítica que puedan ayudar a Sanitas a conseguir sus objetivos estratégicos.
Trasladarás al resto de la organización las iniciativas del área y todos los aprendizajes obtenidos.

Muchas ganas de unirte a un equipo retador, innovador y con ilusión por crecer. Y ademas...

Experiencia de más de 5 años desarrollando soluciones basadas en datos y en entornos innovadores.

Sector: Internet
Descripción:
We are TravelPerk: a fast-growing, well-funded startup that has raised nearly $134m since our creation in early 2015. Backed by world-class investors from some of tech’s most disruptive companies, including Slack, Trello, Twitter, Farfetch, Deliveroo and Delivery Hero, our team is made up of A-players from across the travel industry.

Over the past few years, we’ve been named the fastest-growing SaaS startup in the world by SaaS1000 and featured as one of the hottest startups to watch by both Forbes and Wired. We’re revolutionizing the B2B corporate travel market—worth over $1.3 trillion—by simplifying the process for everyone involved.

In spite of the ongoing global pandemic, we’re continuously growing and adapting to the situation. We’re turning lemons into lemonade—because we’re innovators. We’ve even developed TravelCare, our very own travel risk management tool, to ensure business travelers are safe and sound before, during, and after their trips. Our team continues to emerge stronger and stronger as we adjust to the new normal—and that’s where you come in!

We are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. You will be managing and analyzing all data being processed at TravelPerk in order to create useful insights for strategic purposes. This is an instrumental position to bring the business to the next level, as you will support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in data-driven decision making. Are you ready to take off with us? Keep reading!

What You Will Do
Develop quantitative analysis to drive product and business decisions and strategy
Query datasets from different sources, turn data into information, information into insight and insight into product and business decisions.
Use data to investigate and help resolve issues in our product or processes
Design and implement metrics, dashboards, and reports
Data modelling, design and implementation of ETL processes. Acquire data, consolidate and maintain it in a central database.
Apply visualization techniques to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.
Support Product owners, Marketing, and Management with visual data analysis to facilitate conversations and assist in decision making.


What You Need
Data engineering or Bachelor’s degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Economics or similar.
3+ years of relevant experience interpreting data in a business intelligence, analytics, or data science/data scientist role, including relevant tools, techniques, and technology.
Excellent communication skills, both written and spoken, in English.
Excellent analytical skills.


You Will Need To Prove The Following
You are a Master in data analysis tools (SQL, Google Analytics, and excel)
Experience with statistical packages (Python, R)
Comfortable querying different type of databases (ie PostgreSQL, Elasticsearch)
Experience preparing, consolidating and normalizing data: ETL processes (i.e. Pentaho Data Integration).
Experience with different data visualization and BI tools (ie Tableau, Looker).
The desire to work in an international environment, with minimal direction, and with highly engaged individuals.


What do we offer?
Competitive compensation including equity in the company
Vacation days: 24 in Spain, 25 in the UK or Germany
Flexibility to work from home most of the time.
Health perks, these vary depending on your location
"Flexible compensation plan" to help you diversify and increase the net salary.
Perks such as language lessons, yoga and office food have been put on hold during Covid-19 and will be reviewed


Flexible Work Policy
Until local governments and health professionals say it is safe to work from an office, TravelPerk will offer you 100% remote working from the country you are employed in.
Once it is safe, you will need to be based in or relocate to Spain, UK or Germany for this position.
You can be based anywhere in the country you are employed from but we will require you to travel to the office hub in your country in either Barcelona, London or Berlin twice per week.
In addition, every quarter you will be required to travel to an office hub location for up to 5 days to meet with your whole team and the rest of the company for an event.
We have core working hours.
Team members that want to go to the office more than once per week are welcome to!


We can help with relocation from anywhere in the world, English is the official language at the office. Please submit your resume in English if you choose to apply.

TravelPerk is a global company with a diverse customer base—and we want to make sure the people behind our product reflect that. We’re an equal opportunity employer, which means you’re welcome at TravelPerk regardless of how you look, where you’re from, or anything else that makes you, well, you.

Descripción:
Customer Facing Data Scientists (CFDSs) are critical to making our customers successful. An ideal CFDS candidate should have strong fundamentals of applied data science in business setting, and should enjoy communicating and evangelizing data science solutions to business stakeholders.

Responsibilities
Product
Representing the DataRobot product from a technical standpoint to customers – including demonstrations, conducting proof-of-concept trials, helping clients evaluate success criteria, and training users
Providing the customer’s point of view to DataRobot’s Product team, informing the direction of future product feature development
Data Science
Enabling customers to solve complex data science problems using DataRobot – including problem framing, data preparation, model building, model deployment, model management, and output consumption
In some cases, executing data science workflows for customers
Providing data science knowledge and expertise as a trusted advisor to the client
Project management
Conducting and managing data science projects with customer’s vision of success in mind
Collaborating with Sales, Field Engineers, and the rest of the DataRobot team to identify the best possible resources to move forward customer’s projects
Leadership
Building a long-term trusted relationship with the customer so that the customers can be led towards success
Understanding and empathizing with customers’ pain points of building AI solutions
Qualifying opportunities where DataRobot can be a suitable fit and thus making DataRobot more efficient
Presenting DataRobot in industry conferences as well as creating powerful technical content for marketing purposes

On a day-to-day basis, CFDS work side-by-side with the Sales, Account Management, and Field Engineering teams to help our customers achieve their goals with DataRobot. Internally, CFDS act as the voice of the customer to the Product, Engineering, and Marketing teams.

Main Requirements
4-5+ years of real-world business experience in a data science role
Hands-on experience building and implementing predictive models using machine learning algorithms
Strong customer interaction experience
Strong project management skills
Excellent organizational, communication, writing and interpersonal skills
Familiarity with a variety of technical tools for the manipulation of datasets
Fluency with scripting (Python / R)
Up to 25% travel outside of Madrid (remote work during pandemic)
Language requirements: English and Spanish


Desired
Familiarity with consultative sales process in the analytics marketplace
Familiarity with Hadoop and related Big Data technologies
Experience dealing with complex customer organizations

Sector: Software Internet Videojuegos
Descripción:
Do you want to be part of a worldwide mobile games leader? We are an international team of more than 330 talented SocialPointers , based in sunny & cosmopolitan Barcelona . We create amazing games, positioned in the top rankings of both iOS & Android, that are played & loved by over 50 million fans all over the world.

In 2017 we were acquired by Take Two Interactive (GTA, Bioshock, Red Dead Redemption, NBA, XCom...) & we have been expanding our activities ever since, as well as creating exciting new opportunities for super talented people to join our teams!

Join the challenge & help us make this year the breakout year in mobile social gaming.

We are looking to welcome yet another brilliant Game Data Scientist in our Analytics team, where you will work to understand our gamers’ behaviour, work with the game teams to improve the product, drive retention & user conversion.

Applying quantitative analysis, statistics & programming, you’ll draw business insights that add real value to Socialpoint. To truly make an impact you’ll need to learn quickly & work well in a fast-paced environment while collaborating closely with our Game Teams & Heads of Product.
What will you do in Socialpoint?
Work with the Game Teams to provide insights into user behaviour and answer key business questions.
Perform hands-on research, data exploration and analysis .
Communicate, define and visualize analysis and results to senior stakeholders, including: Head of Analytics, VPs of Product, the CEOs and other C-level executives.
Acting as the liaison between product, game developers, data engineers and data scientists to ensure our data is precisely specified, understood and consistent.
Team up with other data scientists to lead projects on machine learning, behavioural segmentation and monetization.
Using predictive analytics to predict how users will react to changes in the Games.
What are we looking for?
3+ years experience applying analytics to answer business questions and mine for insights that drive value, preferably in a mobile B2C business.
A Masters degree in a quantitative subject area (such as Statistics, Maths, or Social Sciences) from a leading university.
Strong analytical skills in applied statistics or econometrics and prior experience in empirical analysis.
Experience implementing data science models with Python, R or Matlab.
Excellent written and oral communication skills, experience presenting to business stakeholders.
A passion for turning data into actionable insights.
You are fluent in written and spoken English.
Solid skills visualizing findings with a front-end visualization tool like Tableau, Looker or Chartio.
And you are ...
A passionate gamer, this is a must!
Creative and innovative, always looking for better ways to achieve our goals.
A fast learner, highly meticulous, a consummate professional. You bring value into any conversation you have.
Pragmatic, you know how to balance short term and long term deliverables.
A team player, you establish effective relationships to work with others for the win
Able to operate sensitively in multi-cultural environments and build effective working relationships.
What's in it for you as a Socialpointer?
Due to the COVID-19 crisis, we are working remotely until further notice. However, this hasn’t stopped us from offering these great benefits!

You’ll get the newest & most powerful devices & equipment to work with , along with a Spotify Premium account.
An impressive 25 days annual leave, not including public holidays!
Private medical insurance , just in case!
Free Language Lessons.
People development is key for us: an amazing training budget just for you & our internal mobility program offers real growth opportunities!
Drop by our hairdresser ’s for a trim (& forget your wallet).
And whenever we go back to the office....
Monday breakfast + delicious daily lunch menus!
Want to stay in shape? We have a brand new gym, football & basketball teams along with a fantastic physiotherapist.
“An apple a day keeps the doctor away” so we get fresh fruit at the office every day!
Monthly events are there to get you to know your colleagues.
If you are new to sunny Barcelona you can also join our Newbies Club: we offer weekend activities once a month, Spanish lessons & help with all your boring paperwork!

The list just goes on & on... so get your game on & apply now!

Socialpoint is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. You’re welcome on the team no matter where you’re from, who you like, what you look like, or if you prefer Xbox over Playstation. It’s a trick question – mobile wins every time! We hire based on your qualifications and demonstrated ability to perform job responsibilities. Our games are for everyone, and so is our workplace.

¡Seguimos buscando talento…y nos encantaría que te unieras a nuestra familia!

UST además, cree fuertemente en la Diversidad y la Inclusión como la forma de mejorar su fuerza de trabajo operacional, por lo que si tienes Certificado de Discapacidad, esta es tu empresa!

Somos líderes en servicios de tecnología digital y proporcionamos soluciones tecnológicas de gran alcance a grandes compañías a través de proyectos end-to-end, consultoría y soluciones propias.

¿Qué buscamos?
¿Qué buscamos?
Para nuestra área de SMART Data estamos buscando incrementar nuestro equipo del área de proyectos internacionales con un perfil de Data Scientist con un alto grado de experiencia con PowerBI. ¿Qué te ofrecemos?
Acceso gratuito a varias plataformas de formación para que tengas acceso a un amplio catálogo multidisciplinar.

Consultor con experiencia en Data Science tanto a nivel técnico como storytelling

Se valorará conocimiento de soluciones basadas en nube pública (AWS/Azure) o híbridas.

Descripción:
About Glovo

We’re a Barcelona-based startup and the fastest-growing delivery player in Europe, Hispanic America and Africa. With food at the core of the business, Glovo delivers any product within your city at any time of day.

Our vision and ambition are not only to make everything immediately available in your city but it is also to offer our employees the job of their lives. A job where you'll be challenged and have the most fun working in through tech-enabled experiences.

Your Work-life Opportunity

Glovo is looking for world-class Data Scientists to work in our Barcelona office. Are you passionate, proactive, data-driven and hands-on? Do you want to evolve in one of the fastest growing startups of Barcelona, building a product that will change people's day-to-day lives and disrupt the on-demand market?

Be a Part Of a Team Where You Will
Develop, test and productionize predictive algorithms by using state of the art machine learning algorithms and statistical models
Evaluate algorithms through controlled offline (e.g. cross validation with holdouts strategy) and online experiments (e.g. cross validation, A/B testing)
Contribute to one or more of the following areas: time series analysis & forecasting, A/B testing, customer analytics, personalisation & recommender design as well as operational research & optimisation
Design experiments and interpret the results to draw detailed and actionable conclusions
Create dashboards and reports to regularly communicate results and monitor key metrics
Work in cross-functional teams across disciplines such as product, engineering, operations, marketing amongst others


You Have
Research and development experience in industry or academia. Holds at least an MSc, and preferably a PhD in a scientific discipline such as Physics, Statistics, Computer Science or Mathematics
Deep theoretical and applied knowledge in at-least one of the following areas: supervised and unsupervised learning, deep learning, reinforcement learning, game theory, statistical inference, bayesian statistics, causal inference, time series analysis, decision theory, mathematical optimisation
Experience working with large data sets will be a plus
Python and/or R experience;; can independently prototype solutions to problems
Experience with big data technologies (e.g. Scala and Spark) and AWS is desirable
Command line skills
Strong presentation skills in communicating with experts and novices
Fluent spoken and written English


Experience Our Glovo Life Benefits
Enticing Phantom Shares plan
Attractive Relocation package (if applicable ;))
Comprehensive Private Health Insurance
Cobee discounts on kindergarten, transportation, and food
Free monthly Glovo credits to spend on our restaurant products (and zero Glovo delivery fee on all Glovo orders!)
Cool perks such as fresh fruit and healthy snacks every day, beers on Fridays, Culture Days every 2 months!
Discounted Gym memberships
Flexible working environment


What You’ll Find When Working At Glovo
Gas: We work hard with energy and passion for what we do.
Care: We act in the best interest of a sustainable future.
Good vibes: We always see the positive side in every situation and act with fairness and honesty with everyone.
Stay Humble: We embrace mistakes and feedback to learn from them.
Glownership: We roll up our sleeves and get work done no matter our position and level.

If you believe you match these values, we look forward to meeting you!

At Glovo we believe that diversity adds incredible value to our teams, our products, and our culture. We know that the best ideas and solutions come by bringing together people from all over the world and by fostering a culture of inclusion where everyone feels heard and has the chance to make a real impact. It's because of this that we are committed to providing equal opportunities to talent from all backgrounds.

Wanna take a peek into what it's like to work at Glovo? Follow us on Instagram and like us on Facebook!

Glovo is transforming the way consumers access local goods, enabling anyone to get almost any product delivered in minutes. Our on-demand logistics connect customers with independent local couriers who acquire goods from any restaurant or store in a city, as well as deliver urgent packages for a variable fee. As of September 30, 2019, we’re currently present in more than 26 countries across Europe, Latin America, Africa, and Asia.

For additional information on Glovo, please visit https://glovoapp.com/ | Twitter: @Glovo_ES | Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/glovoappES/ | LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/company/glovo-app/

Job Description

Can be based in either Barcelona or Madrid

Understands complex and critical business problems from a variety of stakeholders and business functions, formulate integrated analytical approach to mine data sources, employ statistical methods and machine learning algorithms to contribute solving unmet medical needs, discover actionable insights and automate process for reducing effort and time for repeated use. High agility to be able to work across various business domains. Integrate business presentations, smart visualization tools and contextual storytelling to translate findings back to business users with a clear impact. Independently set strategy, manage budget, ensuring appropriate staffing and coordinating projects within the area supervised. -If managing a team: empowers the team and provides guidance and coaching, with limited guidance from more senior managers.

Your responsibilities:
Your responsibilities include, but are not limited to:
Innovate by transforming the way to solve a problem using Data Science and Artificial Intelligence.
Articulates solutions/recommendations to business users. Presents analytical content concisely and effectively to non-technical audiences and influences non-analytical business leaders to drive major strategic decisions basis analytical inputs.
Coordinates, prioritize and efficiently allocates the team resources to critical initiatives: plans resources proactively, anticipates and actively manages change, sets stakeholder expectations as required, identifies operational risks and enable the team to drives is -sues to resolution, balances multiple priorities and minimizes surprise escalations
Collaborates with internal stakeholders, external partners and Institutions and cross -functional teams to solve critical business problems, propose operational efficiencies and innovative approaches.
Proactively evaluates the need of technology and novel scientific software, visualization tools and new approaches to computation to increase efficiency and quality of the Novartis data sciences practices
Provides agile consulting, guidance and non -standard exploratory analysis for unplanned urgent problem
Independently identifies research articles and reproduce/apply methodology to Novartis business problems
Publishes in peer reviewed journals, helps organizing sessions at external professional conferences and contributes to cross


Minimum Requirements

What you’ll bring to the role:
English Effective communication
10+ years of relevant experience in Data Science Information & Decision, Theories Data Visualization, Machine Learning & Deep Learning, Big Data, Applied Mathematics, Predictive Modelling and Data Management


Why consider Novartis?
750 million. That’s how many lives our products touch. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

We are Novartis. Join us and help us reimagine medicine.

You’ll receive: Company Pension Plan; Life and Accidental Insurance; Meals Allowance or Canteen in the office; Flexible working hours

799 million. That’s how many lives our products touched in 2019. And while we’re proud of that fact, in this world of digital and technological transformation, we must also ask ourselves this: how can we continue to improve and extend even more people’s lives?

We believe the answers are found when curious, courageous and collaborative people like you are brought together in an inspiring environment. Where you’re given opportunities to explore the power of digital and data. Where you’re empowered to risk failure by taking smart risks, and where you’re surrounded by people who share your determination to tackle the world’s toughest medical challenges.

Imagine what you could do at Novartis!

Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion:
Novartis embraces diversity, equal opportunity and inclusion. We are committed to building diverse teams, representative of the patients and communities we serve, and we strive to create an inclusive workplace that cultivates bold innovation through collaboration, and empowers our people to unleash their full potential.

Join our Novartis Network: If this role is not suitable to your experience or career goals but you wish to stay connected to learn more about Novartis and our career opportunities, join the Novartis Network here: https://talentnetwork.novartis.com/network

Descripción:
Wavespace team at EY is looking for Data Engineers to help design and build cutting edge solutions.
   Our brilliant multicultural and multidisciplinary team (more than 25 nationalities) is looking for talents. We have brought together from all over the world specialists in data science, digital technologies, service design, strategy, audit, transactions, law and tax, covering the data life cycle with business acumen.
 The job entails developing and maintaining a hybrid platform to provide analytical services to our clients. While based in this centre of excellence, you will be part of an international, multicultural team and you will actively work on projects, helping to develop analytical workflows and procedures with various technologies in the Data & Analytics field.

Tasks & responsibilities:  
Participate in the design and completion of Enterprise Intelligence transformation projects
Support transformation processes towards a data centric culture
Collaborate with colleagues from other departments, in domains such as risk management, business optimization and customer intelligence
Design and implement technical solutions in various business line areas
 You will apply your knowledge and experience to deliver key projects while being mentored and coached by senior data engineers and talented colleagues across the team. 

Key Requirements

Bachelor or Master in Computer Engineering (or related), Physics, Statistics, Applied Mathematics, Computer Science, Data Science, Applied Sciences, etc
Critical thinking capabilities, with ability to see the ‘big picture’ while also diving into the details when necessary.
Fluent in English; Spanish or other languages are an asset.
You have expertise in one or more object-oriented languages, including Python, Go, Java, Scala, or C++, and an eagerness to learn more.
You have a good understanding of data-modeling principles.
You have experience with relational databases and an excellent SQL fluency.
You have experience working with big data (Hadoop, Spark, Hive).

Preferred:
 Experience leading large-scale analytics projects using Microsoft Azure Cloud Services.
Experience with the following technologies: CosmosDB, MongoDB, Cassandra, Neo4j, Solr/Elasticsearch, Redis.
Experience with ETL products such as Talend, SSIS, Pentaho, etc.
Hands-on experience developing microservices based architectures and the technologies that enable them (containers, REST APIs, messaging queues, etc.).
Experience with Team collaboration tools such as Git, Bitbucket, Jira, Confluence, etc.
Experience with unit testing and continuous integration.
Experience with Scrum/Agile development methodologies.
 
If you feel that you meet these requirement, please apply with CV in English. Please note that, due to extremely high level of applications, incomplete files or applications without CV in English will NOT be taken forward.
 Our commitment to diversity & inclusion
We are genuinely passionate about inclusion and we support individuals of all groups; we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, gender, sexual orientation, or disability status.

Empresa startup ganadora de numerosos premios nacionales e internacionales, que lo está, literalmente petando, cuyo producto es un Marketplace que, a parte de serlo en un sector innovador, ha solucionado y ha tenido un impacto social muy positivo. El equilibrio perfecto entre una gran idea disruptiva y el bien que hace a su sector.
Actualmente buscan un Data Engineer para ser el owner del desarrollo del Data Lake, Data Warehouse, aportando los mejores métodos y de la mejor forma para la ingestión de datos. Desarrollar las herramientas y frameworks útiles para conectar el equipo de Data con el de IT, construyendo pipelines escalables y, al mismo tiempo, haciendo uso de diferentes tecnologías. (esto no parece decir mucho más que cualquier otra oferta, verdad? Pero ahora sigo)
Equipo: Estarás trabajando con otros 3 data analyst, la head de data, y en estrecha colaboración con el DevOps y el equipo IT.

El must de stack: Actualmente están migrando todo su data stack a Google Cloud (Bigquery, Composer). Pero, conocedores de que no es tan común el expertise de esta herramienta en el mercado (aunque cada vez se usa más), estarían buscando a alguien que venga de AWS (Redshift y demás) así como Airflow, y tampoco una excesiva seniority, porque la idea es que tenga los fundamentos y dentro de la empresa poder formarse y crecer. A destacar que como Benefit ellos tienen suscripción a una famosa plataforma de aprendizaje, así como tienen asignado tiempo semanal, en horario laboral, para formarse.
Softskills: Ambiente increíble, dicho por varios miembros del equipo, ya que los conocemos desde hace tiempo. Buscarían a alguien dinámico, que le mole el ecosistema startup, y no le de miedo lanzarse a la piscina a aprender cosas nuevas y últimas tecnologías.
Y esto no es todo, además de un paquete de benefits al que habría que añadir mucho team building, y clases de idiomas, se añade su política 100% remote friendly (aunque restringido por ahora a las personas en el mismo huso horario que España), por lo que, si así lo quieres, y más allá del COVID, puedes continuar trabajando desde tu casa, la cafetería o un lugar paradisíaco de la costa ?
Challengue + la leche de compañía + gran ambiente laboral + 100% remote + muchas más cosas.
Cuál es el salario máximo que ofrecen por esta ganga de oportunidad? 45.000 € bruto/anual
Si te ha interesado lo más mínimo, aplica y te contaré más.

Descripción:
About The Role

People Scientist - Analytics & Compensation

Come join us on our mission to build cultures where employees and their companies thrive. Our product offers a solution that helps companies put people first, and as part of our People team, you will have the opportunity to truly put people first! This is a unique opportunity to be the first People Scientist on our People team as we bring the power of data to our People strategy & programs. This role is based in San Francisco (once we return to the office).

Responsibilities
You’ll be our first People Scientist and will handle analytics/reporting across a variety of topics
Creation & automation of our core reporting across People Operations and Recruiting
Compensation analysis including market pricing new roles/locations as well as conducting more in depth analysis of existing compensation bands
Build & run compensation tools including for our focal cycle and pay equity reviews
Partner with Recruiting, People Operations and People Partners to enable and advise
Run deep dive analysis on People topics to help answer key business questions and advance our People and business strategy


Qualifications
Will consider a range of experience levels, but should have 5 to 7+ years in relevant roles..
Experience can be from business analytics roles outside of the People function -- in this case but must have a demonstrated and long term interest in the People function.
Comfort with ambiguity, autonomy, and responsibility; you enjoy figuring out what needs to be done and then doing it.
Proven analytical and problem-solving skills. Ability to analyze data, understand trends and surface relevant insights based on the analysis.
Ability to go beyond the numbers, connecting insights back to a larger business and strategic understanding.
Very high attention to detail.
Strong quantitative skills and experienced with Google Sheets and/or Excel (Pivot tables, VLookup and basic formulas)


Nice To Have But Not Required
Experience with Compensation tools, processes and concepts
Advanced abilities with Google Sheets / Excel and ability to build dynamic models
Experience with Looker, Greenhouse, Zendesk, Lattice, Bamboo and relevant data capabilities
Prior experience working in a People team


About Lattice

Lattice is on a mission to build cultures where employees and their companies thrive. In an age where innovation is happening all around us, there's commonality – people are driving these changes. We offer a solution that helps companies put employees first. Lattice is a people management tool that offers performance reviews, employee engagement surveys, real-time feedback, weekly check-ins, and goal setting in a way that allows companies to focus on employee development, growth, and engagement. Since launching in 2016 we have grown to over 2000 customers globally, including brands like Slack, WeWork, Reddit, Glossier, and Asana. We are currently 200+ employees and will be well over 300 by the end of the year.

Why Lattice
The opportunity to do HR at an HR Tech company that truly values the People function.
Join a very fast growing company built by an ambitious team that’s passionate about solving customers’ needs and loves coming to work every day. (That’s not rhetoric, we really mean it.)
A rare opportunity to build best in class people programs for a people technology company
A culture that supports and promotes professional growth and development
Competitive salary, equity, and benefits
Centrally located FiDi office; 2 days optional work from home/week (once we return to the office)
Flexible vacation/time-off policy
Other fun perks like continuous learning reimbursements, office snacks & team trip

Descripción:
About Fever

Fever is the global events discovery platform, with a mission to entertain the world and bring us closer to each other. We are looking for bar-raisers, tech-lovers that want to work hard, have fun, and make history with us. Fever combines its digital marketplace and Secret Media Network (Secret London, Secret NYC, Madrid Secreto, Paris Secret, etc) through technology to reach over 30 million people every week.

Fever is also transforming how new entertainment is created across the world, with the international roll-out of our Fever Original content. These are proprietary experiences in which we follow a data-driven content creation strategy, using analytics to understand audiences, develop and optimize new formats.

Our technology is developed by a diverse team based out of our Madrid offices, serving our millions of users across the globe, from Hollywood to Broadway, the London West End, Paris, or Sydney.

About The Role

Fever is looking for a Data Scientist passionate about technology and the use of data and analytics. This is a rare opportunity to work in the New Ventures team to find and help to build next-generation experiences covering each of our international markets.

Fever uses a wide range of data sources to predict new trends and formats and to assess the potential interest of our audiences. The new team member will not only continuously digest and analyse this data but will also collaborate with data engineers to build scalable solutions to systematize and speed up the process of identifying what will become the next-generation of events and experiences in the entertainment industry.

This role requires maturity, pragmatism, intellectual curiosity, outstanding analytical skills, and a proven track record of taking ideas and quickly turning them into action.

Primary Accountabilities
Review, clean, validate and analyze available data to find new trends and opportunities for Fever to invest in
Implement and improve new and existing data analysis methodologies
Create and discover new data sources that could sharpen the reliability of our findings or/and speed up decision making
Cooperate with IT department to deploy software and hardware upgrades that make it possible to leverage big data use cases
Create metrics and reporting functions to measure and monitor the performance of new experiences and developments you recommended based on data
Communicate findings and insights on a regular basis to other teams, including executive leadership. Document those findings.

Required Skills & Experience
Engineering degree, with high achievement results
Experience in data science, with a demonstrable ability to use tools such as SQL, Python, and R to work efficiently at scale
Experience in data visualization and reporting
Outstanding analytical skills, detail-oriented, proactive, and self-motivated with a track record of working independently and conducting research with minimal oversight
Strong knowledge of analytical and data science tools
English fluent, Spanish is a plus
Strong written and verbal communication skills to collaborate cross-functionally and communicate complex topics to audiences with different backgrounds
Ability to tell a story with data

Benefits
Opportunity to have a real impact in a high-growth global category leader
Bonus
Stock Options
40% discount on all Fever events and experiences
Work in a location in the heart of Madrid, with possible travel across our markets
Home office friendly and flexible schedule
Responsibility from day one and professional and personal growth
Great work environment with a young, international team of talented people to work with!
English lessons
Free fruit and drinks!

Descripción:
Descripción del empleo

En ECB Engineering Firm nos dedicamos a la selección y headhunting de profesionales técnicos altamente cualificados en el sector de Tecnología. Más de 10 años de experiencia en el mercado, trabajando con las empresas más importantes del sector avalan nuestra especialización en proyectos nacionales e internacionales.

Actualmente estamos buscando un Data Scientist para importante empresa de seguridad en Madrid. La persona seleccionada de ser un especialista en algoritmos y técnicas de Machine Learning. Tendrá como misión la aplicación de técnicas de Machine Learning, algoritmos de Data Mining y modelos matemáticos a la solución de problemas reales en el ámbito de la seguridad informática: entre otros clasificación automática de Malware y/o identificación de familias de software, tanto goodware como malware.

Buscamos uninvestigador con trayectoria y experiencia acreditada en la aplicación práctica de las técnicas de Machine Learning a problemas reales. La experiencia específica en el ámbito del Deep Learning será además valorado muy positivamente. Requerimos también tener sólidos conocimientos de programación.

Los Problemas Típicos Sobre Los Que Trabajamos Son
Problemas de clasificación: predicción de la clase gw/mw de un elemento desconocido.
Problemas de reconocimiento: dado un elemento desconocido, identificar su familia más probable.
Problemas de agrupamiento o clusterización: distribución/separación de elementos en grupos que comparten características similares por encima de un umbral establecido.
Requisitos
Licenciado en ingeniería superior, - preferiblemente informática o telecomunicaciones -, matemáticas, físicas o similar
Experiencia en el diseño e implementación de algoritmos de Machine Learning/Data Mining y en la aplicación de estas técnicas a la solución de de problemas reales.
La experiencia en técnicas de Deep Learning se valorará especialmente.
Experiencia en programación (C/C++/Java) orientado a la implementación de algoritmos matemáticos optimizados.
Valoramos la experiencia en el uso de tecnologías Big Data (HBase, Hadoop, Storm, Kafka, etc..)
Se considerará positivamente la experiencia en lenguajes y entornos de programación para análisis estadístico como R o python.
Habilidades personales alineadas con las expuestas en la descripción del puesto.
Buscamos una persona con alta capacidad para la resolución de problemas y pensamiento crítico Valoramos la responsabilidad y una actitud de superación. Capacidad de trabajar en equipo en un entorno dinámico con orientación a resultados.

Requisitos Mínimos
Experiencia en Machine Learning &#(;Deep Learning valorado&#);
Valorable programación R y experiencia en Big Data
