Descripción:
About AbbVie

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com. Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Job Summary

From the Business Technology Services (BTS) area we are looking for experts in Data Engineering to join our team based in our Madrid offices. As a Data Engineer, you will have the mission of managing our Data databases to ensure the acquisition, modeling, and visualization of data that will be used to support business decisions aligned with the company strategy.

About AbbVie

AbbVie’s mission is to discover and deliver innovative medicines that solve serious health issues today and address the medical challenges of tomorrow. We strive to have a remarkable impact on people’s lives across several key therapeutic areas: immunology, oncology, neuroscience, eye care, virology, women’s health and gastroenterology, in addition to products and services across its Allergan Aesthetics portfolio. For more information about AbbVie, please visit us at www.abbvie.com.

Follow @abbvie on Twitter, Facebook, Instagram, YouTube and LinkedIn.

Responsibilities
Responsible of data ingestion, modeling, transformation, storage and visualization across the different company data sources, technologies and platforms.
Planning, designing, building and running information management solutions across a variety of technologies (e.g. Palantir Foundry, master data, data profiling, batch processing, etc.)
Ingest data into Foundry analytics platform from external vendors using SFTP
Building data pipelines using Spark and Python by preparing, mapping, joining and stitching ingested datasets
Using programming frameworks/languages like core Spark, Spark Dataframes, Python for data transformation on Foundry
Converting and optimizing existing SQL queries into Spark SQL
Create visualizations in QlikSense
Defining and ensuring data quality of ingested datasets by implementing health and content checks
Build a strong data governance framework by working with global and affiliate stakeholders.
Defining and applying information quality and consistency business rules throughout the data processing lifecycle
Consistently deliver projects in a timely manner. Perform routine and complex tasks competently and independently and generate reliable and consistent results.
Collaborating with information providers to ensure quality data updates are processed in a timely fashion
Ensuring appropriate security and compliance policies are followed for information access and dissemination
Enforcing and expanding use of AbbVie Common Data Model and industry standard information descriptions (ontologies, taxonomies, vocabularies, lexicons, dictionaries, thesaurasus, glossaries etc…)
Produces and maintains required technical documentation associated with work product.
Understand and adhere to corporate standards regarding applicable Corporate and Divisional Policies, including code of conduct, safety, GxP compliance, data security, and the software development lifecycle.
Experience with Hadoop ecosystem(HDFS, YARN, Spark, Hive, Hue) and Amazon Web Services preferred.
Team worker while open to remote working


Qualifications

Qualifications
Degree in Engineering, Mathematics, Physics, Statistics or related discipline.
+5 years of experience in data processing roles such as data engineer, database developer/administrator, ETL developer, data analyst or BI consultant.
Experience programming in languages such as Python and R.
Proved experience managing relational databases (SQL Server, stored procedures, SSIS, SSRS, OLAP cubes, C#, Visual Basic, Oracle or Redshift)
Experience creating dashboards and visualizations (Qlik, Power BI, SSRS, Tableau, etc.)
High level of English (C1)


Highly appreciated
Experience with QlikSense
Experience with Spark
Exposure to Palantir Foundry platform
Knowledge of Pharma Industry

Qualifications

Who You'll Work With
You’ll work with our analytics team in Madrid focusing on machine learning for 2-3 months. This global practice supports clients in many different industries facing challenges of developing and implementing tailored concepts for prediction and prescription.

What You'll Do
You will focus on the development of advanced analytics models to optimize underlying business problems.

In this role, you'll have the opportunity to shape the future of what data-driven organizations look like, drive processes for extracting and use that data in creative ways. You will create new lines of thinking within an infinite number of clients and situations. You will create valuable, transformative business strategies through the measurement, manipulation, reporting and dissemination of broad sets of data.

You will apply and advise on state-of-the-art advanced analytic and quantitative tools and modeling techniques in order to derive business insights, solve complex business problems and improve decisions. Additionally, you will review, support and advise on the day-to-day analytics requirements of clients’ key operational processes while continually improving the impact of these processes.

We are looking for open-minded, passionate, analytical, Researcher Developers with interest in cryptocurrencies and the blockchain ecosystem to join a highly qualified team of technical excellence for one of the most challenging projects in the Bitcoin and FinTech industry worldwide.

Our Innovation/Applied Research Team seeks to incorporate experienced developers who:
Want to put their theoretical computer knowledge into practice, from writing complex data structures to designing critical algorithms for network performance.
Enjoy writing code but also and formally analyzing algorithms and protocols.

As part of the Innovation/Applied Research Team you may have the following responsibilities:
Analyze blockchain designs and code from the security perspective and find design vulnerabilities
Design, evaluate, use, and produce PoC implementations for blockchain technologies
Make sound recommendations based on research findings and product performance
Write research reports, blog posts and scientific papers
Give oral presentations on key blockchain technologies in fluent English
 Experience & Skills Required

Senior-level programming skills in one procedural language
Fluent written and oral English
Willing to work in a fast paced and highly agile environment
Excellent interpersonal and communication skills.
 Other Desired Skills
Subject matter expertise in blockchain and related technologies (computer privacy, computer security, cryptography, number theory, distributed systems, algorithm complexity, data structures, game theory, statistics, economics)
Superior analytical skills, applying conceptual models, recognizing patterns while drawing and defending conclusions.
Strong knowledge and passion for FinTech and financial services, Bitcoin, RSK & Ethereum, willing to work in this fast-moving environment.

Descripción:
Purpose:

Participate in the design and development of Data Processing workloads used both internal and external, to generate system level reports. Internally, the data supports product root causes investigations. Externally, the data is used to provide system level reports.

Essential Functions:

Migrate existing python/pandas and MySQL report processing workloads to Azure/Databricks/MySQL/Delta/Data Factory architecture.
Build new or enhance existing CI/CD pipelines.
Provide support and feedback on migration work done by the team.
Implement logging on cloud to capture the job runs traces and errors.
Implement notifications and control process to identify missing input data.
Initiate VM scripts from Data Factory and report process/track progress of the jobs running.
Normalize schema updates for delta lake without manual effort.
Create a framework to migrate existing on-premise workloads to cloud to ingest data.
Build pipelines to perform ETL using Databricks delta lake (bronze, silver, and gold architecture).
Load data into delta lake and make it available to Tableau and other reporting tools.
Mine and analyze data to drive optimizations and improvements of product development.
Assess the effectiveness and accuracy of new data sources and data gathering techniques.
Develop custom data models and algorithms to apply to data sets.

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities:

Required:

Bachelor's Degree in Statistics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or related field.
3+ years of experience in data engineering.
2+ years of experience working in Azure based deployments (Batch/Real-Time) leveraging Azure SQL, Databricks, ADLS, Blob Storage, ADF, Azure Stream Analytics.
3+ years of experience with one or more of the follow scripting languages: Python, SQL, PySpark, and/or other.
Experience on end to end deployment in Azure with CI/CD pipelines.
Experience working with and creating data architectures.
Knowledge of advanced statistical techniques and concepts and experience with applications (regression, simulation, scenario analysis, modeling, properties of distributions…).
Knowledge of a variety of machine learning techniques (clustering, decision trees, neural networks…) and their real-world advantages/drawbacks.
A/B Testing and test model quality.
Strong analytic and problem-solving skills.
Ability to work on software environments with intermediate to advanced complexity.
Possesses a high degree of accountability.
Excellent verbal and written communications skills.
Self-motivated to learn and keep skills up to date.
High Level of English.

Preferred:

Experience working in a distributed development environment.
Experience with distributed data/computing tools: Map/Reduce, Hadoop, Hive, Spark, etc.
Experience with Agile Software Development.
Familiarity with continuous integration.
Understanding fundamental design principles behind a scalable application.
Excellent time management skills, including multi-tasking and prioritization.
Excellent interpersonal skills.

Travel:

Travel to the United States may be required.

Sector: Software Seguros Servicios financieros
Descripción:
Company Description

ISO, a Verisk business, has been a leading source of information about property/casualty insurance risk since 1971. For a broad spectrum of commercial and personal lines of insurance, ISO provides statistical, actuarial, underwriting, and claims information and analytics; compliance and fraud identification tools; policy language; information about specific locations; and technical services. ISO serves insurers, reinsurers, agents and brokers, insurance regulators, risk managers, and other participants in the property/casualty insurance marketplace. To learn more about ISO please visit us at:  www.verisk.com/iso. We are proud to be a part of the Verisk family of companies!

At the heart of what we do is help clients manage risk. Verisk (Nasdaq: VRSK) provides data and insights to our customers in insurance, energy and the financial services markets so they can make faster and more informed decisions.

Our global team uses AI, machine learning, automation, and other emerging technologies to collect and analyze billions of records. We provide advanced decision-support to prevent credit, lending, and cyber risks. In addition, we monitor and advise companies on complex global matters such as climate change, catastrophes, and geopolitical issues.

But why we do our work is what sets us apart. It stems from a commitment to making the world better, safer and stronger.

It’s the reason Verisk is part of the UN Global Compact sustainability initiative. It’s why we made a commitment to balancing 100 percent of our carbon emissions. It’s the aim of our “returnship” program for experienced professionals rejoining the workforce after time away. And, it’s what drives our annual Innovation Day, where we identify our next first-to-market innovations to solve our customers’ problems.

At its core, Verisk uses data to minimize risk and maximize value. But far bigger, is why we do what we do.

At Verisk you can build an exciting career with meaningful work; create positive and lasting impact on business; and find the support, coaching, and training you need to advance your career. We have received the Great Place to Work® Certification for the fourth consecutive year. We’ve been recognized by Forbes as a World’s Best Employer and a Best Employer for Women, testaments to our culture of engagement and the value we place on an inclusive and diverse workforce. Verisk’s Statement on Racial Equity and Diversity supports our commitment to these values and affecting positive and lasting change in the communities where we live and work.

Job Description

We are looking for a Python Data Engineer who will be responsible for writing, debuging, maintaining and testing our products (existing ones, new modules on existing applications or completely new products). Working with other stakeholders (senior developers, dev managers and technical leads, analysis, test, project management, product owners) to complete the work on the agreed timelines and with the required quality.

Main Responsibilities
Designs and build component-based applications in a web/internet delivery environment, alone or with other developers I or II.
Works on new and existing applications along with enhancements to websites, web applications, and infrastructure.
Scopes, implements, tests and deploys new features and versions of core applications, databases and utilities.
Performs hands-on coding and assists in the design of solutions.
Raises issues during development cycle (running late, blockers, lack of analysis, etc.)
Prepares reports, manuals and other documentation on the status, operation and maintenance of software when asked by his/her managers.
Provides documentation of user's requirements, development of user stories, and estimates when requested to do so.
Assists with providing third-level support to business users.
Helps with code reviews.
Writes design technical documents.
Mentors Software Developer Engineers I.
Participates actively in planning meetings, retrospectives, daily stand ups, and other meetings as part of the software development process.
Updates progress in our systems (i.e. move items to the right status, remaining effort, etc.).

Qualifications

We are ideally looking for an experienced Data Engineer with the following:
Bachelor’s degree preferred in Computer Science or other relevant field and demonstrable related experience.
Working knowledge of all phases of the software development life cycle.
Expert in object-oriented programming concepts, unit & integration testing, data and relational databases, technical database design, web architecture and application servers.
Strong ability to document development including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications.
Knowledge of Agile development methodologies helpful.
Strong skills of design patterns.
Deep understanding about performance and scalability implications in the development process and experience with performance monitoring tools.
Ability to install complex software patches and upgrades.
Ability to review code written by others and provide feedback and recommendations to follow coding guideline.
Able to provide estimates.
Demonstrated ability to write technical documents including database design, application design and ongoing documentation of changes and modifications.
Demonstrated experience with N-tiered applications, multi-tier architecture, and production Internet architectures.
Demonstrated ability to learn and adapt to continuously changing technology.
Be able to design considering operational costs.
Desire to lead a work stream coordinating a small team of developers.
Ability to do a risk analysis.
Independently productive being able to face most tasks on their own and understand when they need to ask for help.

Additional Information

Verisk Analytics is an equal opportunity employer.

All members of the Verisk Analytics family of companies are equal opportunity employers. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, religion, color, national origin, citizenship, sex, gender identity and/or expression, sexual orientation, veteran's status, age or disability.

Verisk will NOT pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume.

El equipo de Data está entrelazado con todas las unidades de la empresa. Somos una empresa basada en datos que transforma toda la información valiosa en conocimiento, negocios y comprende mejor a nuestros clientes y usuarios.
El análisis de datos nos permite optimizar nuestro trabajo, desarrollar estrategias y nos anima a seguir explorando nuevas.
¿Qué usamos?
Trabajamos con varias tecnologías analíticas de última generación. Queremos seguir creciendo y ampliando nuestras capacidades. Las tecnologías de datos cambian y emergen constantemente y estamos listos para adoptarlas.
¿A quién buscamos?
Buscamos incorporar a personas entusiastas, que sientan verdadera pasión por la tecnología y con ganas de sugerir e innovar.
Como Data Engineer, formarás parte del equipo de Data. Tu trabajo influirá en el futuro de CompuTrabajo y en nuestras soluciones TI para el sector de los RRHH.
Cada mes, recibimos más de 92.000.000 de visitas, se publican más de 270.000 ofertas de empleo, tenemos más de 730.000.000 de páginas vistas y se generan millones de búsquedas.

Sector: Marketing y publicidad Software Dotación y selección de personal
Descripción:
Data Scientist in Barcelona
Are you an experienced Data Scientist that wants to join the newest studio of a worldwide games industry giant? Its a unique opportunity to work with well loved classics while also creating the next generation of mobile games all while located on the beach in Spain!
Youll head up the planning, execution and ongoing optimisation of ad campaigns, working closely with the wider team to ensure growth across all of the games. Part of your time will also be focused on the key KPIs which will be achieved alongside MMPs, internal account managers and external agencies.
This studio already has a core team of experienced, diverse and dedicated people but youll be joining only months after the studio opening so will have a real impact on games and studio.

Data Scientist Responsibilities

Work with large, complex data sets to manipulate and analyse behaviour of players
Use your behavioural analyses to provide recommendations for strategic and operational business questions
Work with in-game data to help build game features and product roadmaps
Strive to produce the best games possible using data insights on retention and monetization
Create automated dashboards and reports that will be used by the whole studio to understand the game data and how this relates to the in-game experiences

Requirements For This Role In Barcelona

Background working with data in the games industry, preferably within mobile games
Experience working with SQL especially large, complex data sets
Examples of work with Tableau or similar for analysis and visualisation
An extensive body of work showing off your detail orientated approach and problem solving skills
Experience turning complex concepts into actionable recommendations
Degree level education in a mathematical/quantitative subject
A little bit about the city: Barcelona
Barcelonas stunning beaches, balmy weather and striking architecture are all great reasons to settle in this beautiful city. Home to many restaurants, museums and traditions, theres certainly a lot to explore. One feature the city is certainly proud of is that it is home to 8 UNESCO World Heritage Sites, largely thanks to Gaudis architecture which can be found at various sites citywide.
Barcelonas compact city centre and excellent transport system make getting around trouble-free and commuting time minimal. Home to a flourishing international community, Barcelona is a great city to relocate to if youre hoping to feel at home.

Descripción:
We invite you to join Vodafone to build a future together, in a position where you can learn new things every day and have contact with the different business units of the Company, as well as related institutions and public bodies.

VOIS is embarking on a global transformation of data; analytics to enable the VOIS Data Ocean which will enable us to unlock value through machine learning and AI.
The Group Google Cloud implementation provides VOIS with the capability to derive value from its data using complex analytics. As the platform expands and data increases, it will become increasingly more important to ensure that VOIS data is managed correctly adhering to Vodafone and external data and security practices.

The role of the Data Governance/Data Steward is to work with the Architecture, Data Science and Delivery teams to establish technical and processes to manage the data on our platforms. The role of the librarian is to manage data and the policies that apply to it on the platform. The librarian is a hybrid role combining the accountabilities of a data custodian and steward.

Role Interaction
Will work closely with data architect team implement data quality and meta data blue print, with data owners to improve data quality and meta data;
Will work with Data Engineering and Delivery teams to implement solutions
Will work with operations staff to ensure processes and procedures in place to manage data
Will work with data scientist to understand data demands and issues
Will work closely with the Corporate IT System team leading the GCP implementation to ensure full adherence to their principles, rules and guidelines.
Will work with data scientist to understand data demands and issues.
This role will play a key role to enable scaled development teams to meet the delivery needs across multiple service lines.

What you bring?
Understand and used GCP technologies.
Exposure to data lake or data warehouse implementation.
Worked in agile environment.
Experience of preferably with development, database skills as a foundation.
Experience of working in a matrix organization.
Influence and execute using other teams.
Good communication skills.
Why Vodafone?
At Vodafone we are concerned about being a company committed to diversity as an engine of change. We are proud to offer equal opportunities regardless of race, nationality, cultural origin, sex, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability and religious or political beliefs.

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Recursos humanos Aeronáutica/Aviación
Descripción:
Ryanair Holdings plc, Europe’s largest airline group, is the parent company of Buzz, Lauda, Malta Air & Ryanair DAC. Carrying over 154 m guests p.a. on more than 2,400 daily flights from 82 bases, the group connects over 200 destinations in 40 countries on a fleet of over 475 aircraft, with a further 210 Boeing 737’s on order, which will enable the Ryanair Group to lower fares and grow traffic to 200m p.a. by FY24. Ryanair has a team of over 19,000 highly skilled aviation professionals delivering Europe’s No.1 on-time performance, and an industry leading 34-year safety record. Ryanair is Europe’s greenest cleanest airline group and customers switching to fly Ryanair can reduce their CO₂ emissions by up to 50% compared to the other Big 4 EU major airlines.

The Role

We are looking for a Senior Data Engineer to work in a multi-disciplined team, working alongside Developers, Designers and Product Owners, who will own their work from the initial idea to the final implementation. We are continually gathering information on travel related events and are looking for someone to help us make the most of a large-scale distributed data system. The role will allow for opportunities to work in a variety of areas such as digital, logistics, predictive maintenance, and anything else that you may think of, or that will come your way.

Requirements

The Person
Big Data Experience with technologies like Hadoop, Spark, Kafka, Cassandra, Mesos/YARN
Evidence of Data Processing at Scale – designing, developing and continually improving tools
Experience in any of the following areas is a bonus – APIs, Personalisation (classifiers, recommendation & prediction services), automation
Experience designing, developing, testing and continually improving tools which deliver scalable and effective data infrastructure systems
Evidence of delivering continual improvements in availability, scalability, monitoring, concurrency, fault tolerance, latency, automation and related areas
Cloud native system design
Familiar with Hadoop administration, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting
Designing ETL/ Data Load architectures within the Hadoop Ecosystem
Streaming applications design with Storm and Spark Streaming


Required Skills
Develop Spark applications in Java, Scala or Python
Solid experience in SQL and Java / Scala programming
Clear understanding of Hadoop stack, its architecture and configuration
Familiar with Hadoop administration, monitoring, performance tuning, troubleshooting
Experience with cloud architecture (AWS) would be a plus
Streaming applications design with Storm and Spark Streaming would be a plus
Fluent in English


Our tech stack includes (but isn’t limited to)
Hadoop (HDFS, Spark, Impala, Hive, Oozie) - Cloudera
Java, Python, Scala, R
AWS (S3, EC2, EMR)
Flume, ElasticSearch, Kibana
MS SQL Server 2016


Benefits

Flight Benefits

Sector: Dotación y selección de personal Venta al por menor Servicios financieros
Descripción:
¿Te sientes identificado con la metodología Agile y tienes ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos? ¿Te apasiona la ingeniería de datos y quieres seguir cogiendo experiencia en una de las empresas lideres en el sector del almacenamiento y transporte de hidrocarburos? Si es así, ¡No dejes pasar esta oportunidad y apúntate a esta oferta!

El Grupo CLH es la principal empresa de almacenamiento y transporte de productos petrolíferos de España, y que además, tras el acuerdo con Inter Pipeline (IPL) para adquirir 15 instalaciones de almacenamiento en Reino Unido, Irlanda, Alemania y Países Bajos, se ha convertido en la principal empresa logística de productos líquidos en Europa. El Grupo CLH está integrado en España por CLH, CLH Aviación y TERQUIMSA (Terminales Químicos, S.A.). Además cuenta con presencia internacional a través de CLH Pipeline System (CLH-PS) Ltd. en Reino Unido, CLH Aviation Ireland en Irlanda y Orpic Logistics Company L.L.C. (OLC) que desarrolla su actividad en Omán.
El Grupo CLH desempeña un papel clave para garantizar a la sociedad un acceso fácil y seguro a los productos petrolíferos y basa su gestión en criterios de compromiso con la sostenibilidad, la seguridad, la eficiencia y la colaboración con la sociedad, como recoge su Misión, Visión y Valores.

Ofrecemos
Salario: según valía y experiencia.
Incorporación a un sólido Grupo multinacional que valora a sus colaboradores
Flexibilidad en horario de entrada y salida
Formación, apoyo y aprendizaje constante dentro de un equipo muy experimentado, con excelente ambiente de trabajo y profesionalidad.
Participar en el desarrollo de las iniciativas ágiles de nuestro HUB Digital, donde utilizamos las tecnologías más punteras en materia de Machine Learning, Deep Learning, Edge Computing, Cloud Computing, IoT, RPA, NLP y otras muchas.
Requisitos
Grado en Ingeniería, Matemáticas, Estadística, Física, Económicas o similar
Bases de datos, SQL, procesos ETL, Power BI.
Persona Agile Mindset y con experiencia utilizando metodologías ágiles en entornos de trabajo colaborativo.
Habilidades de comunicación efectiva (Data Storytelling).
Valorable experiencia con ecosistema de Azure y conocimientos de programación con Python, así como formación de Data Scientist.
Idioma Inglés nivel alto (mínimo B2 - 800 puntos en TOEIC).
Experiencia deseable de al menos 1-2 años en tareas similares
Responsabilidades
La persona que buscamos se integraría en nuestro equipo del HUB Digital y trabajaría muy alineada con los Product Owners de negocio, con el ingeniero/a de datos y con el científico de datos, y se encargaría de utilizar en la práctica el planteamiento de infraestructura propuesto por el ingeniero/a de datos, y de realizar todas aquellas operaciones ETL necesarias (Extracción, Transformación y Carga de datos) para que el Científico de Datos pueda desarrollar sus modelos. También sería la persona responsable de estructurar la visualización de los datos, generar informes, así como de la retroalimentación e integración de los modelos generados por el científico de datos para su consumo por parte de negocio (Business Intelligence). Pero en CLH sabemos que la experiencia no lo es todo y por eso valoramos también que tengas entusiasmo por unirte a nuestro proyecto y que seas una persona comprometida, proactiva y con ilusión por afrontar nuevos retos.

¡Por lo demás, nosotros te ayudaremos e impulsaremos en todo momento!

Sector: Software Internet Videojuegos
Descripción:
Madbox is a mobile gaming company, creating and publishing its own games worldwide. After two years of existence, Madbox has gathered more than 100 million players, still growing. We are looking for top talents with mad skills, a mad passion and a mad ambition to join us.

We are looking for a passionate and experienced data engineer to join us!

As the first Data Engineer in the team you will be responsible for end to end data pipelines and data architecture for all the Studio’s games.

Based in Barcelona, you will have the opportunity to work with the Data team and the game teams to keep delivering and improving the company's Data solutions. We evolved in a flat-structured creative environment where ownership and accountability are our two mantras. We look for high-energy individuals ready to bring Madbox to a global stage.

What will you do ?
Working closely with the head of data, data scientist, automation team and data analysts to develop and own our data pipelines, infrastructure & roadmap.
Implement high end scalable solutions, cost optimised and with high performance.
Monitor all the pipelines to ensure high availability.
Proactively responsible for data accuracy and reliability for all models and entities.
Mad Skills & Experience Required
Required :
Experience with Big Data systems architecture
Experience in Data Pipeline scripting in python
SQL skills
Experience in cloud platforms GCP/AWS and their data services (Preferable knowledge in GCP Dataflow)
Experience with GIT and Airflow
Bonus : Experience in Typescript and Unity programming (C#)
Note: You will be required to pass a technical test.
You also have
Autonomy and ability to take decisions and make projects move forward while keeping transparency and continuous updates to relevant stakeholders
An analytical mindset.
A good and fluent communication skills: straight to the point, focused on constructive feedback, positive mindset
High interest in tech and Games in general.
Shown leadership in proposing innovative actions to perform to improve globally speaking.
What's the Madbox mindset?
You are a humble yet ultra ambitious individual
You are a team player and a game maker at heart
You are T-shaped and enjoy small structures where everyone has a strong impact
You want to learn and grow in a passionate environment
What we offer?
Competitive salary
Private medical cover
Lunch vouchers
Team events (once we're all back in the office)
Madbox is a fast-growing mobile game company based in Paris and Barcelona, creating and publishing its own games. The story of Madbox started when two video game studios fell in love with each other during the summer 2018.

A few months after the beginning of this promance, Madbox first in-house titles hit the top charts of the App Store and Google Play Store worldwide, ranking in #1 positions in more than 100 countries. After just two years of existence, Madbox has gathered more than 100 million players, still growing fast. To fuel this creative and operations growth, Madbox develops cutting-edge automation systems internally to shorten production times and drive accurately its performance at large scale.

www.madbox.io

Madbox will collect your personal data for the purposes of managing our recruitment related activities. That is why, Madbox may use your personal data in relation to the evaluation and selection of applicants. Your information will be accessible to recruiting & people teams in Paris & Barcelona. By applying, you expressly give your consent.

Sector: Servicios y tecnologías de la información Software Internet
Descripción:
CARTO is making a huge impact on some of the most important global corporations (Google, Mastercard, T-Mobile, Vodafone) developing custom solutions on top of its powerful geospatial platform.

We are looking to incorporate to our Solutions Team a creative professional eager to work with data engineering, helping us to define automated solutions to ingest, analyze and process terabytes of spatial data with the ultimate Cloud Native platform.

Do you have a passion for solving the most cutting-edge customer problems with data and analytics? Do you want to be part of a high performing team at a rapidly growing tech company with an awesome culture? Do you have expertise and demonstrated success dimensioning and defining geospatial solutions? If so we want to talk to you!

Some our current challenges are solving problems like: design high scalable platform to calculate optimized routes of gas&oil pipelines over terabytes of spatial data and hundreds of constraints in seconds, predict revenue for simulated stores in a whole country applying ML techniques, or process, aggregate and enrich billions of transactions across the globe to serve them in a real-time application.

From smartphones to connected cars, location data is changing the way we live and the way business happens. Everyone, from business analysts to data scientists, use our software and location data to understand where and why things happen, optimize business processes, and predict future outcomes.

Backed by leading VC firms Accel Partners, Salesforce Ventures, Earlybird Ventures, and Kibo Ventures, CARTO is poised to lead the location intelligence (LI) space.

This position is based in our Sevilla office, although we accept candidates working remotely.

You Will
Work with an experienced team to build cutting-edge data processing systems that feed beautiful maps and meaningful geospatial apps for international customers.
Research, arrange and aggregate terabytes of data to get the most accurate insights for CARTO customers. Don't count data, make data count.
You will learn everything there is to know about mapping technology and how companies around the world are using CARTO to gain insights through location and predictive analysis.
Build scalable ETL pipelines based on platforms like Prefect or Airflow in an elastic cloud infrastructure.
You will be able to self-promote and become a tech leader, who will be a referent for the rest of the team.
You are
A human being with an insatiable thirst for learning.
Quick to grasp new concepts and quick to take on new challenges.
Experienced building ETL processes with Python and familiar with the Python Data Analysis stack: Pandas, Numpy, GeoPandas, Scikit-learn, etc.
Ideally, experienced with large databases and data warehouses like BigQuery, Redshift or Snowflake.
Someone who has enjoyed working with various databases and has solid SQL foundations.
Mature in your approach to software development, in how you test, fine tune, and document when required.
A skilled communicator, and fluent in English.
Willing to contribute to our culture of openness, constant feedback, and iterative improvement.
We offer
Competitive, results-based compensation.
Flexible work hours in a focused but casual environment.
Private medical insurance and stock options.
Growth prospects at a truly welcoming multicultural and multilingual company with a supportive, team-work oriented work environment.
An opportunity to get in early to a company that will be category defining, backed by the same VCs that have backed companies like Facebook, Slack, Dropbox and Cloudera.
A big vision: to help the world use location-based data to make better decisions. We believe that openness and sustainability are baked into this vision, and we’re sharing it with the world.
To Apply

Provide us your resume and explain your interest. Be sure to let us know why you’re a great match for this role and for CARTO!

Do you feel that you don't check all of the requirements? At CARTO we believe that professional development happens through teaching and learning from your peers and managers. Even if you’re uncertain about whether you have the experience we’re looking for, please apply if this position sparks your curiosity.

A diversity of identity, perspective, and experience makes us stronger. We welcome you to apply to CARTO regardless of your background, gender, ethnicity, orientation, or ability.

To learn more about us, please visit our blog or follow us on Twitter (@carto) or Instagram (@cartohq).

| YOUR CHALLENGES?
We are currently seeking flexible and fast-thinking Cloud Big Data Engineers.
Depending on your expertise and affinity, areas of application may include Retail, TELCO, Energy, IOT Distributed Systems, Mobility and Healthcare. The work will mainly be conducted in project teams of various (technical) disciplines. It is crucial that you have a good overview of the possible applications of your expertise and that you’re able to motivate this to others.

As a Cloud Big Data Engineer in our team you will be challenged with:
Designing and/or building the data model and its complex processing infrastructure that meets the business’s requirements;
Transforming large, complex data-sets into pragmatic, actionable insights;
Leveraging data to identify, quantify and realize tangible business gain;
Having the capacity to thrive in our fast-paced environment, adapting quickly and taking ownership of your work;
Managing innovative ideas and methods while working together with talented, highly skilled team members.
We focus on delivering quality work, supporting our customers and above all, attitude! That’s why we expect our people to feel at home in all areas of today’s development.


| WHAT DO WE EXPECT FROM YOU?
Perfectly fluent in Spanish, you have a BSc. or MSc. in software engineering, computer science, (theoretical) physics, econometrics, statistics, scientific computing, bioinformatics or comparable background. Degree in Computer Sciences, Informatics or related field required.

During your studies or through professional experience (minimum 3 years of relevant experience is required) you have gained expertise in one or more of the following topics:
Strong technical skills regarding, data(base) modeling, data warehousing and programming;
Strong working knowledge of Python, R, Java, Hadoop, Cloudera, Kafka Ecosystem, Snowflake, Spark, Scala-Spark, Flink, Hive, HDFS, Impala, Kudu, API's, SQL, and / or noSQL;
• Strong working knowledge of Cloud: Azure, Amazon Web Services or Google Cloud Platform.
Strong working knowledge of designing and implementing common BI applications, such as Tableau, Qlikview, Spotfire, Splunk, SAP, SAS, or others;
Proven experience and affinity with designing and building of data processing solutions, data storage solutions, cloud solutions, and / or database management;
Experience with processing large data sets (> 1 TB) is considered a plus;
Knowledge of Agile methods is considered a plus;

In addition to these technical skills developed through your industry experience, you have developed strong soft skills such as good oral and written communicative skills, stress resistance and a team player attitude. Serious motivation for the Employeneurship model of TMC is also required.
Your profile matches these expectations? Let’s talk about your plan!


| WHAT DOES OUR BUSINESS CELL HAVE TO OFFER?
Be part of the TMC Software Factory, our Development Center that provides IT expertise and development based on best practices and accumulated experience to all our clients. We excel in agile development and IT engineering.
Who we are?
High Performance Development Center
Technological solutions tailored-fit for each customer
Capability to work with a variety of technologies
Software quality & security compliance best practices
Continuous delivery to customers
Cybersecurity compliance
We invest in technological surveillance


| WHAT CAN YOU EXPECT FROM TMC?
TMC is an international high-tech consultancy company that brings expertise to their clients in order to support them with the realization of their technological challenges. As such, TMC is operating as an expert center at the disposition of its clients and we help them to be more competitive in an ever more global and faster changing technological world.
At TMC we believe that people are the driving force behind technological innovation. That is why we want to create the best possible conditions for tech talents to thrive in. We offer you a challenging and stimulating work environment in which you can be the director of your own career.
As an Employeneur you are part of our TMC family. Next to our outstanding technical expertise, fun and engagement are meaningful parts of our culture.


| WHY CHOOSE FOR EMPLOYENEURSHIP?
We are truly unique thanks to our Employeneurship model which is a true innovation for the High Technology consulting business. It is the business relationship of the 21th century for high skilled technical professionals. It is built around 5 main pillars:
You will have a permanent employment contract, offering you stability and security
You will get to know your market value and have a share in the profit your work generates thanks to the individual profit sharing
We will support you with a one-on-one coaching and trainings designed to help you develop your entrepreneurial skills
The competence cells structure, provides you with a strong meaningful and relevant network
The entrepreneurial lab: a playground for new ideas and a potential launching for start-ups

Data Scientist/Científico de Datos en Madrid.
Necesitamos a una persona de mentalidad curiosa a la que le gusten las aplicaciones móviles el video online las redes sociales la publicidad y las marcas. Que se sienta cómoda con los números para poder identificar oportunidades que surjan de los datos.
Fundamental que se defienda bien con Power point y que sepa redactar bien.
Requisitos técnicos imprescindibles
Programación en R.
Experiencia en analítica.
Somos Smartme una compañía con un fuerte componente tecnológico dedicada a obtener procesar y analizar Big Data de los usuarios de Smartphone.
La recopilación de datos primarios a través de dispositivos móviles es una forma precisa de capturar información de los consumidores. La información recabada a través de la tecnología Smartme permite mejorar de forma constante la captación y la retención de los clientes así como tener un conocimiento competitivo continuo sin precedentes lo que permite a los clientes de Smartme mejorar sus resultados empresariales.
El equipo de Smartme joven y dinámico se compone de científicos y analistas de datos con clara vocación y visión de generar propuestas de valor tecnológicas y de negocio.

Estamos buscando un CIENTÍFICO DE DATOS para incorporar en nuestras oficinas de Madrid.
Actividades a desarrollar
Manejo y gestión de redes sociales apoyando al product manager.
Formación en tecnologías y metodologías de tracking para medir y analizar comportamientos de mercado.
Asistencia en la medición de audiencias y gestión de audiencias compartidas.
Medición de eficacia publicitaria.
Apoyo en la elaboración de informes sobre estudios de mercado.
El objetivo es formar a una persona en tecnologías y metodologías de tracking observacional para inferir perfiles comportamentales algoritmos de madurez de posicionamiento mobile de las marcas de cara a establecer diagnósticos de inteligencia competitiva. También conocer nuevas técnicas de análisis de audiencia de eficacia publicitaria predicciones de targets más afines según productos y marcas etc.
El foco de la formación estará centrado en ser capaz de extraer conclusiones de interés para el negocio.
R, Microsoft Powerpoint, python, tableau

Enviar mensaje InMail
DATA ENGINEER - 100% REMOTE

What is Homyspace?

Homyspace is a startup founded in Valencia. We provide temporary accommodation for companies and workers posted in the main Spanish and European cities. Property owners and managers now have a legal and secure solution to rent their flats on a seasonal basis by accommodating companies with mobile employees.
We are living an exciting journey: in addition to solving a problem for many companies, Homyspace is scaling and we are facing exceptional challenges at this stage. Do you want to be a part of the journey?

Who are we looking for?

We are looking for a Data Engineer to help us build a self-service analytics platform and progressively evolve its work area to be key in the growth of the company.
Your initial objective will be to make analytics an accessible, replicable and reliable product for the end consumer (business stakeholders) and from there on offer new solutions and functionalities.

What will you do?

As a member of the Lab Department and in close contact with the development team, you will help Homyspace make data-driven decisions.
As a Data Engineer, you will be responsible for building the Homyspace data platform (data warehouse) from where the business logic is modeled:

- Modeling of business logic with dbt.
- Management of the data warehouse in BigQuery.
- Connecting different data sources with Stitch.
- Creation of the self-service analytics platform with Metabase.
- Designing, building and maintaining other real-time/batch data pipelines and ETLs that can consolidate and clean up for analytics purposes.
- Promotion and training of the tools you create to encourage their use among business stakeholders.
- Communication with the business stakeholders to establish the requirements, the design and the subsequent implementation of models.
- Documentation and testing of models.
- Continuously identify, evaluate and implement new tools and approaches to maximize development efficiency.
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to define, execute and release new services and features.
- Assistance to other departments for ad-hoc decision making.
- Key contribution to the creation of the Data team.

Requirements:

- At least 2 years of experience in coding and delivering complex data projects.
- Experience in Data Engineering in collaboration with data scientists/analysts.
- Proficiency in relational and non relational databases: SQL.
- Proficiency in building ETLs and data pipelines.
- Knowledge and use of modern data processing technology stacks in cloud environments (AWS).
- Advanced knowledge of Python.
- Knowledge of dimensional data modeling for analytics and BI purposes.
- Experience working with agile methodologies.
- Experience with testing processes and best practices when programming.
- Desired experience with Git.

What we offer?

Join a young and dynamic environment with an excellent work atmosphere. Teamwork is our hallmark.
Flexibility to work from home 100% of the time.
Work in a real agile environment, guided by objectives rather than by a work schedule.
Participate in projects with cutting-edge technology where you can learn every day.
Real possibilities to grow with the company and promote based on the merits and opportunities that arise.
Continuous training and positive and honest feedback from your managers (mistakes are accepted as something natural, we can learn together).
A fixed and competeitive salary, according to contributed values, plus group incentives, so that the entire team will row in the same direction.
Special events and celebrations.

If you are looking for a different and exciting project, we are looking forward to meeting you!

Buscamos personas con distintos grados de experiencia y conocimiento. Si eres arquitecto/a data, también podrías tener cabida en nuestra tribu.
 Si además de la experiencia requerida, eres una persona a la que le gusta mantenerse al día con las nuevas tecnologías, entonces, ¡serás la persona que estamos buscando!
 Y como no todo es pedir... ¿Qué te ofrecemos?

Descripción:
To get the best candidate experience, please consider applying for a maximum of 3 roles within 12 months to ensure you are not duplicating efforts.
Job Category
Products and Technology

Job Details

MuleSoft is looking for an experienced Data Architect to join our talented Training & Certification team to strengthen the impact of our data and the consumption of it in our organisation, cross-functionally and for our customers and partners.

In this role, you will help us make the Training & Certification data available cross-functionally by positioning how it can influence business outcomes. You will collaborate with Data Engineers and Sr. Business Analysts and co-own Training & Certification Data Models.

Your expertise in data architecture and business outcomes will be key to understand the impact of the different data scenarios. You will evaluate new and existing data requirements, own and support the completion of those requirements and provide executive summaries of the results.

You will collaborate closely with the Head of Global Data Strategy at MuleSoft Training & Certification to support the design and execution of the strategy and the delivery of the outcomes.

What You’ll Achieve
Identify, design, and implement internal process improvements: automating manual processes, optimizing data delivery, re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability, etc.
Monitor and report on how Training & Certification Data is being used and what business outcomes are driving.
Identify opportunities to use Training & Certification Data to drive business outcomes by working with leaders within our team and cross-functionally with other data owners and stakeholders.
Design and implement a security architecture that will be robust and scalable for future needs
Drive adoption of Training & Certification data and reporting in the team and cross-functionally.
Enable MuleSoft teams on the business value of Training & Certification based on data analysis.
Establish best practices and standardise data across the Training & Certification team.
Recommend and influence the Data Strategy for Training & Certification to maximise performance.
Recommend and implement solutions to improve the quality of the Training & Certification data.
Establish governance in Training & Certification data.
Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements.
GDPR and Privacy Data
Design conceptual and logical data models
Become the SME and anticipate future needs
Research and properly evaluate sources of information to understand and define possible limitations in reliability or usability

What You’ll Need To Be Successful
Experience working with cross-functional teams
Proven work experience as a Data Architect, Data Scientist, Data Lead
Experience gathering and analyzing data requirements
Understanding of predictive analysis and data visualization techniques.
Hands-on experience with SQL and Integration Tools
Strong knowledge of database structures and data mining.
Excellent organizational and analytical abilities.
Problem solver attitude
Experience working with private and sensitive personal information
Considerate in decision making and the ability to explain processes or choices as needed
Experience in visualisation tools such as Tableau, Qlik or Power BI or equivalent
Accommodations - If you require assistance due to a disability applying for open positions please submit a request via this Accommodations Request Form.

Descripción:
Company Description

Adevinta is a global online classifieds specialist, operating digital marketplaces in 12 countries. The company provides technology-based services to connect buyers with sellers and to facilitate transactions, from job offers to real estate, cars, consumer goods and more. Adevinta’s portfolio spans more than 30 digital products and websites, attracting 1.3 billion average monthly visits.

Our leading brands include top-ranked leboncoin in France, InfoJobs and Milanuncios in Spain, and 50% of fast-growing OLX Brazil. Adevinta spun off from Schibsted ASA and publicly listed in Oslo, Norway in 2019. Adevinta is majority owned by Schibsted ASA and employs 4,700 people committed to supporting users and customers daily. Find out more at Adevinta.com.

At Adevinta, we draw on the principles of successful marketplaces to do our job well. We actively exchange ideas, and we’re always learning from each other. We are a company where everyone belongs, and our culture is based on mutual trust. Above all, we keep a strong focus on creating and developing value - because we believe every house can be a home, every person can be useful, and every object can live a second, third or fourth life. And we leverage our scale to help build a sustainable future where everything can find its purpose or a new one.

Job Description

The BI and Data Engineer role effectively and comprehensively manages Adevinta's data set to create dashboards and reports, auditing and ensuring the accuracy of data inputs, and troubleshooting any potential data issues or risks in the systems integrations. Ensures that data and reports are accessible, usable, easy to understand, and appropriately/consistently applied within Adevinta teams. Works with various departments and provides input to the Information Services team regarding what needs to be implemented, optimized, modified, created and prioritized in relation with data.

This mission critical role is placed within the BITS (Business Information and Technology Services) team, in charge of supporting Adevinta Central Functions and Marketplaces in the achievement of its goals with seamlessly integrated and resilient business information and technology services, as well as providing guidance on new trends in productivity and business process automation.

Your main responsibilities as BI and Data Engineer will be:
Develop and maintain reports as well as provide Tableau support to marketplaces.
Provide analytics capabilities to those Adevinta functions that doesn’t have this capability internally.
Work with multiple Adevinta departments and understand their individual needs and objectives.
Manage data, including the creation, update and deletion of data, information and dashboards; commission and decommission datasets based on business needs and priorities.
Process confidential and proprietary information in compliance to information policies.
Build dashboards based on business needs.
Identify trends and statistical behaviours on business information with a focus on growing and improving the business.
Provide training to Adevinta end users on new dashboards, systems and reports.
Identify improvement initiatives in relation with information reporting across Adevinta.
Help the business areas to identify new information datasets and sources that could lead to profitable insights.
Execute the necessary initiatives aimed at implementing the MDM Strategy at Adevinta.
Identify and oversee initiatives for data integrity and normalization within and across Adevinta departments, and within and across systems.
Monitor MDM-related costs and quality.

Qualifications

Your skills and qualifications include:
Solid analytical and logic skills
Experience in Computer Science and algorithm management
Experience with Data Modelling tools
Experience with Tableau
Proficient knowledge of popular and standard data analysis tools and databases, with a high level of knowledge of methodologies and processes for managing large-scale databases and systems
Experience in statistical languages and tools
Python development experience
Advanced knowledge in database technologies (e.g. SQL, PostgreSQL, SQLServer, SAP HANA and NoSQL databases)
Must show initiative, proactively finding and solving problems
Be a business-focused, creative, innovative, pragmatic, and positive team player
Good analytical and problem-solving skills to visualize solutions
Ownership and result oriented person
Good written, spoken and interpersonal communication skills
Technical and business level English is a must
Excellent organisational, data management and data documentation skills

It Would Be Great If You Would Also Have
Proven experience in projects managing a set of various data sources
Experience with and the ability to troubleshoot large data sets
Ability to quickly learn new or unfamiliar technology and products using documentation and internet resources
Knowledge and understanding of relevant legal and regulatory requirements
Experience in Data Migration / Systems Implementation
Experience with one or more data management tools
Experience with Data Quality & Lineage management tools
Experience with Big Data Management tools
Knowledge on Data Modelling tools
Spanish and French are a highly valuable asset

What Do We Have To Offer

Additional Information
A unique position in an international and dynamic environment
Opportunities to work on a global level, with senior management on strategic issues
Excellent growth opportunities close to top management and their priorities
The chance to be a key player in a growing, highly skilled team
Competitive compensation package
Great colleagues and a healthy working environment

This role will be based in Barcelona with occasional travel to other offices.

Adevinta is an equal opportunity employer and values diversity in our company. All applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Descripción:
What about the Data team?

At Exoticca, the Data team is the main responsible of making data essential in key decision making across the whole organization. We capture vasts amount of data from multiple customer touch points, spanning from consideration and booking, to pre-travel, travel, and post-travel. Combined with our customer-centric approach, we believe that our data-driven culture is the key to deliver unparalleled product & services, that wow our customers and create unforgettable experiences to be remembered for a lifetime.

In order to achieve such ambitious goals, the Flights Team works together with other departments, in order to ingest large amounts of data from our flights providers - on a busy day, we need to handle over 250k unique flight searches, yielding to terabytes of data on a weekly basis. Such data needs to be ingested, transformed and analyzed, looking for patterns and enabling the Flights Team to uncover the most valuable insights our data can deliver, such as flight routes optimization, fare fluctuations, improvements proposals as well as determining the best moment to issue a particular flight for our customers. There are a myriad of opportunities for using data to improve our performance as a company, increase customer satisfaction, optimize & automate processes, and much more. We can’t wait to have you on board!

What is our proposal?

Join us as a Data Engineer, based in our Barcelona offices.

Which will be your main responsibilities?
Be part of a team that takes end-to-end responsibility for designing, building, and maintaining batch & real-time data pipelines and data solutions.
Create solutions to enable diagnostic and predictive analytics capabilities.
Research, evaluate, and propose different data solutions in an agnostic way.
Select, setup and manage tools & technologies to build and support a robust data infrastructure.
Propose and help decide on the data modeling and schema design of our data stores.

Requirements
2+ years of work experience in a similar role as a Data Architect or Engineer.
Proficiency with Python. Experience in Java or Scala is also acceptable.
Experience with data warehouses, data lakes and data marts.
Experience with relational databases and NoSQL databases.
Familiarity with cloud-based, distributed systems and orchestrated ETL processes (AWS is preferred).
Experience in data management, integrating and transforming data from multiple sources, including internal DBs and APIs with product & marketing tracking tools.
Fluency in English.


Benefits
Competitive salary package, in line with the job’s responsibilities.
Immediate incorporation and permanent contract.
Benefits package flexible schedule, trainings, and the possibility of travelling at reduced prices!
And most importantly… becoming part of a highly successful multicultural team!

Description

We are seeking for individuals with high expertise and breadth of data knowledge who also have the ability to partner with stakeholders internally (such as the Machine Learning team, Customer Success team) as well as externally. This role will be part of a small team under Business Finance.

We are looking for an independent minded Data Engineer who can help us to build a new data warehouse-infrastructure and help us to maintain data discipline across the company.

Primary Tasks Will Include
Build and maintain a data pipeline infrastructure for ETL with a wide variety of data sources, using SQL, cloud based relational, and/or non-relational databases to create Tabular Cubes
Design, implement & maintain Azure (PaaS, DBaaS) and on-premise SQL server architecture
Maintain current End Of Life DWH (Multidimensional) until Azure setup is completed
Perform tasks such as: data collection, data cleaning, data aggregation
Assemble large and complex data sets to meet functional/non-functional business requirements


It Will Be Beneficial If You Are Able To
Identify and automate process improvements - Optimizing data delivery and re-designing infrastructure for greater scalability
Perform tests and evaluations regularly to ensure data security, privacy and integrity
Determine, enforce and document database policies, procedures and standards
Monitor database performance, implement changes and apply new patches and versions when required


Requirements
Minimum 3 years of experience in a similar position
Bachelor’s or master’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering or similar
Experience with Microsoft data stack (on-premise and Azure) is mandatory
Database administration & -design experience including data warehousing and data marts is mandatory
Strong knowledge about
DAX, ETL, TSQL coding, stored procedures, views, troubleshooting & debugging is mandatory
Data Management Tools (CI/CD, DevOps) is highly beneficial
A genuine interest in exploring and utilizing new technologies and platforms
Be a self-starter and comfortable working in a fast-paced environment
Exceptional problem-solving skills
Sufficient coding skills to independently gather data from various sources (for example C++, Python…)
Knowledge of Power BI is a plus
High level of English language skills
Being able to convey your results, methodology, etc. through conversations, written communications or data visualizations


Benefits

LanguageWire is a community where communication is open, informal and friendly. The fact that we respect each other personally and professionally promotes collaboration and a positive social environment. We celebrate success and giving and receiving feedback and recognition is a natural part of our corporate culture.

Technology is a big part of what keeps LanguageWire ahead of the competition, but we never forget it’s a business built and powered by people. We ensure that our entire team is happy in what they do, and everyone has the tools they need to achieve. Because at the end of the day, that’s why our customers love to work with us – they enjoy working with a team of enthusiastic people!

If you have any specific questions regarding the position as Data Engineer, please contact Julia Ajchsztet, Talent Acquisition Partner, at juaj@languagewire.com.

Descripción:
Westerman is looking for a Senior Data Scientist for one of the most important clients in the Retail Industry in Barcelona.

Job Description
Your role will be to be part of growing team Digital Hub based in Barcelona, to create and support global digital developments for PepsiCo. These developments will be around topics like revenue management, supply chain, manufacturing, logistics.

You will be part of a collaborative interdisciplinary team around data, where you will be responsible of building deployable statistical/machine learning models, starting from the discovery phase. You will work closely with process owners, product owners and final business users. This will provide you the correct visibility and understanding of criticality of your developments.

This Role Will Support The Following Activities
Partner with ML engineers working on industrialization.
Coordinate work activities with Business teams, other IT services and as required.
Drive the use of the Platform toolset and to also focus on 'the art of the possible' demonstrations to the business as needed.
Communicate with business stakeholders in the process of service design, training and knowledge transfer.
Build data-driven models.
Set KPIs and metrics to evaluate analytics solution given a particular use case.
Refine requirements into modelling problems.
Research in state-of-the-art methodologies.
Create documentation for learnings and knowledge transfer.
Create reusable packages or libraries.

Requirements
4+ years’ experience building solutions in the revenue management or in the supply chain space.
4+ years working in a team to deliver production level analytic solutions.
4+ years’ experience in ETL and/or data wrangling techniques. Fluent in SQL syntaxis.
4+ years’ experience in Statistical/ML techniques to solve supervised (regression, classification) and unsupervised problems. Experiences with Deep Learning are a plus.
3+ years’ experience in developing business problem related statistical/ML modeling with industry tools with primary focus on Python or Scala development.
Strong communications and organizational skills with the ability to deal with ambiguity while juggling multiple priorities
Experience with Agile methodology.
Experience with Azure cloud services is a plus.

Descripción:
Are you a data-driven engineer who can assist stakeholders on a global scale? Looking for a role that gives you the freedom to create and innovate? Then keep reading…

Our story (the bitesize version)

Here at Just Eat Takeaway.com, we deliver delicious dishes across 24 countries worldwide. From fries in Frankfurt to tacos in Toronto, millions of food-lovers order from us every day.

Our recipe for success is all about tech. From data engineers to backend developers and IT Support experts, our talented tech teams help us continue to innovate and grow.

All About The Role

As our Senior Data Engineer, you're part of the diverse Data Engineering team based at our Amsterdam HQ. The team's goal is to support our existing platform, in addition to creating new components and integrations and ensuring production runs smoothly.

And You'll Also Have The Chance To

It's your job to verify data integrity and transform it into the best format for each stakeholder, using the right tools to support their operational work.
Collect and transform unstructured data from different sources into a structured output – e.g. columnar databases, flat or Parquet/ORC files, NoSQL or streams
Use your skills and best practices to create reliable, frequently/continuously running pipelines.
Create reusable, maintainable and scalable integrations & services, using a cutting-edge cloud infrastructure
Model and test data, implement proper logging and troubleshoot any issues swiftly
Collaborate effectively with team members and other stakeholders in Agile iterative processes

Can you deliver…

Ready to be our next Data Engineer? Here is what we need from you:
4+ years' experience in handling big data pipelines, data warehouses or other (preferably distributed) data stores
In-depth knowledge of Python, including 2+ years' experience
Proficient in working with Airflow
Experience with MPP data warehouses like Redshift, Teradata, Snowflake and databases like Postgres, Oracle, MySQL etc.
Experience in the cloud is preferred (AWS, GCP, Azure)
Skilled in parsing structured and unstructured data. Knowledge of data warehousing is a plus
An independent way of working: you prefer deploying services on the cloud instead of waiting for a DevOps engineer to hand you servers
Passionate about clean code and ideas, and able to strike a balance between development speed and documentation + testing
Fluent English (written & spoken) and good communication skills

Here Is Our Offer

Like the perfect food pairing, your skills and these great rewards belong together:
Competitive salary
An impactful and varied role as part of a talented, diverse team
The chance to join a fast-growing global tech business with flat hierarchies
Opportunities to learn new concepts and develop as both an engineer and an individual
Great team & company events
26 days of holiday per year
Contribution to your travel costs and budget for ordering lunches
Generous relocation package to move to the Netherlands (please only apply if you want to work in Amsterdam)

Don't miss out on this exciting data engineering role. Click Apply Now and send us your CV!

Descripción:
We are looking to hire software engineers with +5 experience and passion for data, based in Barcelona/Madrid 

Job Description
We are looking for software engineers with at least five years of experience and a passion for data. We expect our (senior) data engineers to keep learning new technologies, architectural patterns, programming languages and machine learning algorithms. They will work with data scientists and are comfortable speaking their language. We are looking for professionals who are enthusiastic about innovation in software engineering and are not afraid to contribute to open-source projects and present their work at technical meetups.
 As we help our clients to target, measure and improve mission-critical business metrics and generate demonstrable return on investment, our (senior) data engineers enjoy a high level of responsibility and immediate client interactions. In addition to technical excellence, our engineers are great communicators equipped with the presentation skills to operate at executive level.
 Above all, our engineers are curious about the big picture and passionate about bringing data to life!
 Our products
Together with data science team we make our customers happy. We design and build data lakes for processing hundred terabytes of data, integrate applications, maintain ML pipelines, help data science team with experiments.
 Our technology stacks
We use Azure, AWS and Google cloud services. In most of the cases we build big data of fast data-oriented solutions, by this reason, we use Kinesis, Lake Formation, Athena, Redshift, Glue, Azure Functions, Events Hub, Data Factory, SageMaker, BigQuery, BigTable, DataFlow etc.
For on premise solutions, we use Hadoop stack, ELK stack, Postgres, Kafka, NoSQL solutions like Cassandra, Redis, Aerospike etc.
We prefer to build applications on Python, occasionally Scala.


What do we offer?
We want to enable you to get the most out of yourself both as a professional and as a person! You will enjoy a high level of responsibility while being guided and mentored by more experienced colleagues. From day one, you will experience a very steep learning curve. Learning on the job will be combined with a bespoke personal development plan and a fit-for-purpose training curriculum.

We highly value and support a healthy work-life balance. As an output-oriented firm, we trust our people to deliver if and when needed. Meanwhile, we also urge them to constantly take ownership over their personal lives and stay healthy, both physically and mentally.

Metyis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All aspects of employment, including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. At Metyis we do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, non-disqualifying physical or mental disability, national origin or any other basis covered by appropriate law. You are encouraged to self-identify, on either your application form, covering letter or resume.

Responsibilities:
Engineers complete technical solutions to solve concrete business challenges in the areas of digital marketing, eCommerce, Business Intelligence and self-service analytics.
Collect functional and non-functional requirements, consider technical environments, business constraints and enterprise organizations.
Support our clients in executing their Big Data strategies by designing and building operational data platforms: ETL pipelines, data anonymization pipelines, data lakes, near real-time streaming data hubs, web services, training and scoring machine learning models.
Collaborate closely with partners, strategy consultants and data scientists in a flat and agile organization where personal initiative is highly valued.
Share data engineering knowledge by giving technical trainings.
Guide and mentor team members.

Required Knowledge, Skills & Experience

Who are we looking for?
·      3 years of professional experience in software engineering
·      A broad practice in multiple software engineering fields:
Backend and/or frontend development in any programming language of your choice
Design of web services
Algorithms and complexity analysis
Linux system administration, development and production environments
Cloud, container and microservices infrastructures
Software security
Development workflow automation
A strong focus on data processing:
Databases; theory and practice
Distributed data processing
Real-time event processing
Concepts of functional programming
Data privacy and anonymization techniques
Enterprise data warehousing, business intelligence and ETL principles
Statistics and analytics
Machine learning
Speaking Spanish fluently is a must
Ability to work in the English language with strong written and oral communication skills
Position based in Barcelona and/or Madrid

Anunciado por
Marina Dávila

Enviar mensaje InMail
Software is a vocation for us, not just a job. We bring creative developers together to solve difficult problems in complex environments.
 At GuideSmiths we value amazing technology and even better people: working exclusively with modern technologies and allowing people to find their own space and letting the team form to its strengths. We love challenging work and delivering value, building bespoke software solutions, in a modern and agile way, always striving to accelerate, innovate and succeed for our clients.

We are looking for you!

Test and deploy the integrations and reports.
Improve existing solutions.
Develop documentation throughout the software development life cycle (SDLC)
Serve as an expert on these topics and provide technical support.

Are an experienced Data Engineer (more than 3 years of professional experience)

Deep expertise of SQL and its different flavors (Microsoft SQL Server, PostgreSQL, Oracle)

Passionate for data, how to extract meaning from it and how to visualize it in a simple yet compelling manner
Able to work remotely within an international team
Team player
Proactive and excellent communicator
Always seeking for continuous improvement
Problem-Solving.
Clients and results orientation 

What do we offer?

Competitive salary

Professional career development

Corporate Culture based on Agile development and fluent communication.

Best hardware for Developers (i.e. MacBook Pro and 27-inch screen)

Carlos Esquivel, Chief Architect at GuideSmits and passionate about technology. His background goes from backend, frontend, database, to cloud technologies in a variety of business scenarios and environments.
José González, Software Engineer and DevOps at GuideSmiths. He enjoys designing platforms and architectures for microservices, creating CI/CD pipelines on AWS and Azure.

Are you a specialist in data analysis with extensive experience in collecting, transforming and analyzing data as well as communicating findings across the organization?

In this role, you’ll be… Pivotal in the execution of a three years roadmap to achieve a more preventive, customer focused and data driven Quality approach at Markem-Imaje. This role will specifically focus on Data Analytics and statistical analysis related to Product, Service, Process quality and performance and will be influential in improving those. This position is reporting directly to the Global Quality Shared Services Manager.
You’ll have an opportunity to… work in a cross-functional environment, partnering closely on all levels of the organization to ultimately improve the quality and performance of our products, services and processes using your data analysis, machine learning-based tools and IT skills.
You should possess… a passion for leveraging data to drive decision making across the business and be a forward-thinking individual to look beyond the immediate.

Great package including bonus, career growth and great benefits.

Principal Activities / Duties / Responsibilities:

You will be responsible for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualizing data from a wide variety of sources as it relates to the performance of our products, services and key business processes. Your main responsibilities will include:
•Exploring any and all available data for extraction, transformation, analysis and visualization, incl. proposing new ideas and solutions.
•Design, development, maintenance and improvement of processes and tools for managing, extracting, transforming, reporting and visualization of data.
•Development and maintenance of tools aimed at automation of existing processes and data bases.
•Working closely with end users to translate requirements into data-driven applications and data visualization solutions (e.g. reporting and dashboards).
•Transforming data into value: communicating findings and recommended actions across the entire company in an international environment.

Experience & General Skills:   
•Minimum 5 years of experience in a similar role including experience as Data analyst.
•Bachelor’s degree in business, Science or Engineering/University degree in Data Analysis.
•Mastering programming tools such as SQL, PL/SQL, Python or R.
•Master Excel at an advanced level with Visual Basic. Experience on Power BI is a plus.
•Fluent in written and spoken English.
•Excellent written and verbal communication and the ability to present data to all levels in the organization.
•SAP CS/SD/MM and Lean Six Sigma certification are a plus.
•Independent, quick learner with a very structured approach.
